title: Limited Third Key Supervisor
description:
JOB SUMMARY: The Third Key overall responsibility is to assist the Store Manager in leading a radical customer and employee experience that drive Key Performance Indicators (KPI) results that maximize store performance. As a part of the overall role, a Third Key Performance is based on 3 major areas of responsibility: People, Product and Place.

ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES: (Other duties may be assigned as needed.)

People: • Demonstrates and ensures the store team embodies Fossil’s 6 Core Values in a spirit of Collaboration (Be Passionate, Be Relentless, Be Authentic, Have a sense of Humor, Be Resourceful, Be Creative). • Execute Fossil Brand Philosophy and Company Vision. • Demonstrates leadership amongst peers by demonstrating personal customer service and selling skills, participating and being fully engaged in team meetings, being proactive in building knowledge of Fossil and the role. • Develop skill set in Interviewing & Hiring process. • Partners with Store Manager on Action Plans based on Division of Responsibility (DOR) to exceed goals/plan. Communicates successes, opportunities and solutions to Store Manager. • Aids in setting the standard of Team Performance. Recognizes performance issues and communicates details to Store Management Team in a timely fashion. • Partners with Store Manager to acquire skill set to establish goals that are specific, actionable and based on established KPI’s. • Gain knowledge and develop team-selling skills to deliver a Radical Customer Experience utilizing all training materials provided.

Product: • Provide consistent Radical Customer experience through flawless presentation standards & detailed product knowledge. • Participates in Floor sets, Plan-o-Gram’s (POG) and all merchandising tasks to ensure they are executed on time and within allowable hours. • Knows the best sellers, the required placement, and ensures that sales meet or exceed company performance. • Learns product knowledge utilizing tools provided.

Place: Operations: • Ensures operational tasks are completed such as replenishment and recovery of merchandise, cash handling and overall store organization/appearance. • Performs operational tasks such as replenishment and recovery of merchandise, cash handling and overall store organization/appearance. • Achieve or exceeds Sales Plan • Achieves or exceeds Average Dollar Sale (ADS), Items Per Customer (IPC), Multiple Item % (Multi %) and Conversion • Maximize customer experience through effective time & task management plan. • Maintains highest level of compliance standards to complete tasks including, but not limited to Fossil’s Policy and Procedures and Loss Prevention Standards. • Maintains high level of personal integrity and accountability and expects the same from their peer group and is willing to report violations/discrepancies to management (including but not limited to adhering to Loss Prevention practices and policies, work published schedule, accurate timekeeping records, etc.). • Manages all aspects of Loss Prevention and adheres to external and internal procedures for theft, inventory management and operations controls.

MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS: To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

* A passion for customer service. • Relentless, can do attitude. • Ability to connect with team. • Outstanding communication skills. • Collaborative, energetic and engaging. • Retail business comprehension. • Flexible work schedule. • Minimum 2 Years Retail Management or Sales Lead experience. • College Degree preferred not required.

JOB COMPLEXITY

Works on assignments that are extremely complex in nature where independent action and a high degree of initiative are required in resolving problems and developing recommendations.

SUPERVISION

Acts independently to determine methods and procedures on new assignments and supervises the activities of other nonexempt personnel.

PHYSICAL DEMANDS: The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. While performing the duties of this job, the employee is frequently required to stand, walk, talk and hear. The employee frequently is required to handle, or feel and reach with hands and arms. The employee is occasionally required to sit; regularly climb or balance; and frequently stoop, kneel, crouch, or crawl. The employee must regularly lift and/or move up to 25 pounds, frequently lift and/or move up to 25 pounds, and occasionally lift and/or move up to 25 pounds. Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, distance vision, color vision, peripheral vision, depth perception, and ability to adjust focus.

WORK ENVIRONMENT: The work environment characteristics described here are representative of those an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. While performing the duties of this job, this employee will regularly travel to various locations and occasionally work in high, precarious places, be around fumes or airborne particles and toxic or caustic chemicals.

* Flexible schedule

* Night shift

title: Wireless Sales Representative - AT&T
description:
With almost 2,000 AT&T stores coast-to coast, Prime Communications is AT&T's largest authorized wireless retailer in the United States, and we want you to join us as a Retail Sales Consultant!



A Retail Sales Consultant (RSC) is a **brand** ambassador to our extraordinarily large base of customers nationwide. **Our RSC associates** serve the customer by demonstrating AT&T's vast array of products, services and entertainment options, **by** offering them **personalized and valuable wireless, entertainment, and connectivity** solutions to **fit their ever-evolving lifestyle** in a **fast-paced retail sales** industry.



Because we strive for the best, we offer amongst the best. Our current full-time Retail Sales Consultants earn a minimum base of ($25,000 + commission). Consultants could earn an average of $45,000 in total compensation in the first year when successfully meeting or exceeding sales goals in the first year. Commission is based on meeting outlined sales goals for a given market.



You'll also be eligible for some or all of our amazing Benefits Packages, such as:


* We offer New Hire Ramp Up Bonus payments for the first three months
* Training and Opportunity to grow
* Supportive team environment
* Medical/Dental/Vision, Paid Time Off, 401k and more


Not to mention some pretty cool perks such as:


* Latest devices and discounts on wireless service plans
* Using our technology, gain first-hand expertise to share with our customers
* Discounts on accessories and additional AT&T products and services, meaning you will always have access to the latest gadgets around


Dedication is always a good predictor of success at Prime Communications. Most Store Managers, were once RSCs, most District Managers were once Store Managers, etc. Join the community and forge your own sales path today!


* Provide extraordinary customer service by being compassionate towards and understanding their needs
* Build value by offering tailored and thoughtful solutions to fit each person, family or business
* Represent our Company and the AT&T brand with the utmost professionalism and courtesy
* Assist our leaders with store operations and duties
* Cooperate with your fellow RSCs to achieve a team approach to sales and customer service
* Achieve sales benchmarks and milestones (which can lead to that much needed extra bonus payment)
* Excel in selling AT&T's products/services, including entertainment, as we are a full-service lifestyle solution
* Work with wireless leaders to stand out, serve and succeed within the local community

Requirements:
**Requirements**


* Clear communication skills

Attitude and technical aptitude * - having an entrepreneurial spirit speaks volumes  

Commitment to exemplary customer service, honesty and integrity
* Background in retail sales is helpful, but not required
* At least 18 years old and legally able to work in the United States without restrictions.
* Ability to work a minimum of 32 hours per week including evenings, weekends, and holidays.
* Strong Social Media presence preferred
* Must have reliable transportation to location, off-site trainings, and meetings.
* Must live within 30 minutes of home store location with flexibility to work at multiple locations within a district as needed.
* Ability to operate a personal computer, wireless equipment, copier and fax.
* Adhere to Team Color policy while maintaining neat and professional appearance.


**Working Conditions**


* Ability to lift up to 10 pounds.
* Ability to bend, squat and stretch for purposes of inventory and stocking.
* Requirement to stand for long periods of time in order to provide the best customer service (with or without a reasonable accommodation).
* Ability to work in fast pace environment.
* Ability to follow instructions to completion.
* Ability to work under pressure, multi-task and handle customer complaints or requests.
* Ability to adapt to fluctuating noise levels and varied sounds from multiple media sources/devices.
* Problem solves under pressure.  

	+ Job Type: Full-time
	+ Pay: $40,000.00-$50,000.00
	+ Shift: 8 hour shift
	+ Weekly day range: Weekend availability

title: Warehouse Supervisor
description:
**Warehouse Supervisor - Distribution Center**



Location: Piscataway, NJ



Position: Full-time with benefits package



**Position Summary**



The Warehouse Supervisor leads and oversees the performance of all tasks involved in the shipment, requisition, and storage of product, supplies and equipment into and from this facility with the guidance of the Distribution Center Manager.



**Key Responsibilities**


* Supervise and lead team of Warehouse Associates in a fast-paced and detail-oriented distribution center.
* Shipping and receiving
* Stores materials/equipment
* Controls Inventory
* Upholds environmental health and safety standards.
* Works closely with internal customers (Store Associates and Sales Managers)
* Provides excellent customer service to external customers (mechanical contractors, dealers, owners)
* Supervises and assigns tasks to Warehouse associates based on business needs and customer priority.
* Ability to run reporting and review data for warehouse performance and efficiency.
* Ability to quickly assess team needs and change plans and actions in real time to support business needs.


**Skills**


* Supervisory skills including leading, motivating, instructing, and disciplining warehouse associates as needed.
* Oversees shift product flow, facility layout, and security and maintenance activities.
* Improves workflow processes to increase productivity and drives work force safety.
* Managers created damage, inventory shrink and product repairs.
* Manages partnership with LTL providers including cost control, damage claim rate and customer satisfaction.
* Experience with MS Office, Warehouse and Logistics Software and ability to learn and train others on use of systems and equipment such as inventory management, scanners, tablets, forklift, clamps lifts and other as needed.
* Manages fleet of third-party logistics provider delivery trucks including routing efficiency and customer service

Requirements:
**Minimum Qualifications and Experience**


* High School diploma required, and associate degree preferred, but not required.
* Minimum 5-7+ years of warehouse operational experience
* Experience training and leading others
* HVAC experience or similar industry is preferred, but not required.
* Strong attention to detail and accuracy
* PC skills and inventory and shipping/receiving systems experience required.
* Excellent communication (written and oral) and interpersonal (Teambuilding) skills
* Proven commitment to customer service and a safe work environment
* Must be team oriented.
* Experience with shipping, receiving, RF Scanners and UPS World Ship
* Ability to exhibit leadership, accountability, teamwork, and dedication to customer service.


At **Carrier Enterprise (CE),** we proudly distribute industry leading Carrier, Bryant, Payne and other brands of HVAC and Refrigeration equipment, as well as a full line of aftermarket parts, supplies, and accessories. As a joint venture between Watsco and Carrier, we are part of one of the largest HVAC Distribution Network in North America. CE has approximately 200 locations throughout 28 states, Puerto Rico, the Caribbean, Latin America, Mexico and Canada. We strive to deliver the best products with best-in-class customer service.



**Mission:** At CE, our associates create an exceptional customer experience by providing innovative solutions to propel business forward. We accomplish this by exemplifying our core values…safety, integrity, teamwork, innovation, service-minded, and community oriented.





**Learn more about our company and team at** **www.carrierenterprise.com** **and** **www.watsco.com**



Carrier Enterprise offers a competitive total pay and benefit package and is an Equal Opportunity Employer.



All applicants applying for employment must be authorized to work in the United States.

title: Counter Sales Associate
description:
Homans Associates (HA) is a subsidiary of the largest independent HVAC/R distribution company in the world, Watsco, Inc. We proudly distribute the Mitsubishi and Bryant brands of HVAC equipment, as well as a full line of HVAC residential and commercial parts, supplies, and accessories. We have locations throughout New England, New York, and New Jersey. We currently have an opening for a Counter Sales Associate in our Teterboro NJ. location. There is no relocation assistance offered for this position.



Company Website: http://www.homans.com

  

**Responsibilities:**  

* Sells heating, ventilation, and air conditioning (HVAC) equipment, parts, and supplies
* Greets customer on sales floor or receives telephone call and determines make, type, and quality of merchandise desired. Discusses use and features of various parts; demonstrates use of merchandise.
* Displays merchandise, suggests selections that meet customer's needs, and emphasizes selling points of article such as quality and utility. Maintain a clean and organized showroom.
* Reads catalog, or computer for replacement part stock number and price. Advises customer on substitution or modification of part when replacement is not available.
* Uses computer database to research availability of merchandise. Fills customer orders from stock or prepares transfer from other location. Prepares sales order or quote order.
* Receives payment or obtains credit authorization. Examines defective articles returned by customers to determine if refund or replacement should be made.
* Solicits new and established customers via telephone to promote sales. Resolves or alerts management regarding inventory issues or customer concerns.
* Works in the warehouse.
* Works with clerical staff to check and maintain open orders, purchase orders, return merchandise purchase orders. Assists in maintaining current and accurate warranty return authorizations and their credit adjustments.
* Follows direction provided by counter lead (if applicable) and lends support to warehouse staff in their duties.

* Other duties as assigned


Requirements:
**Qualifications:**


* Excellent customer service skills  

	+ Practical knowledge of warehouse, data processing, paper flow and operations procedures.
	+ Must have the ability to negotiate transactions on an intra- and inter-company level. Must possess the ability to mediate situations among employees and customers as they arise.
	+ Beginner to intermediate to advanced user of the Internet and Microsoft Office Products (Word, Excel, and Outlook).
	+ Ability to learn new software quickly and accurately.
	+ Ability to calculate figures and amounts such as discounts, interest, commissions, proportions, and percentages. Ability to apply concepts of basic algebra.
	+ High School Diploma or GED required
	+ While performing the duties of this job, the employee is occasionally required to stoop, kneel, crouch, or crawl. The employee must occasionally lift and/or move up to 50 pounds. Any lifting from 50-75 would require assistance from another employee.
	+ Prior HVAC experience is required

title: Commercial Banker III - Philadelphia, PA
description:
**The position is described below. If you want to apply, click the Apply Now button at the top or bottom of this page. After you click Apply Now and complete your application, you'll be invited to create a profile, which will let you see your application status and any communications. If you already have a profile with us, you can log in to check status.**


Need Help?

*If you have a disability and need assistance with the application, you can request a reasonable accommodation. Send an email to* *Accessibility* *(accommodation requests only; other inquiries won't receive a response).*

**Regular or Temporary:**


Regular**Language Fluency:** English (Required)

**Work Shift:**


1st shift (United States of America)### **Please review the following job description:**


Identify, solicit, develop, manage, service, retain and grow long-term profitable commercial relationships for clients with $5MM to $75MM in annual sales. Offer a full range of loan, deposit, and fee-based services to existing and prospective commercial clients. Leverage the CCB Industry & Advisory teams as appropriate to create the optimal client experience. Refer business and personal financial needs of assigned clients through the appropriate channel according to Integrated Relationship Management (IRM). Levels (I – III) should be differentiated based on years of commercial banking experience, portfolio size, and overall potential in the role per leadership discretion.**Essential Duties and Responsibilities**


Following is a summary of the essential functions for this job. Other duties may be performed, both major and minor, which are not mentioned below. Specific activities may change from time to time.


Leverage the Truist Sales Process, Financial Insights, and the Industry & Advisory team to consistently deliver a differentiated client experience in all client, prospect and center of influence (COI) interactions. Manage, service and grow an assigned book of commercial banking clients. Execute on prospecting activities to grow new commercial banking households. Understand and contribute to the credit decisioning process, including analysis and interpretation of financial statements, credit structuring, underwriting requirements, policy knowledge, risk identification and mitigation, all in accordance with the Truist credit risk appetite. Focus on driving continual improvement in portfolio revenue growth and new production revenue. Proactively contact clients to fully develop commercial banking relationships by executing on Integrated Relationship Management (IRM) principles. Include the identification of all business and personal financial needs and bring in the appropriate partners to deliver Truist solutions. Monitor, maintain and update sales activity, pipeline, and other pertinent information using the Bank’s client relationship management (CRM) system. Execute on all risk, operational, policy and quality expectations related to assigned client portfolio.

**Qualifications**

**Required Qualifications:**


The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.


Bachelor's degree, or equivalent education and related training More than eight (8) years of experience with proven results in establishing new business relationships and retaining/growing existing business relationships Strong command of credit and finance Excellent verbal and written communication skills Excellent negotiation skills Demonstrated proficiency in basic computer applications, such as Microsoft Office software products.

*“This position requires an individual who may physically work within Philadelphia or be required to travel to Philadelphia for work. The starting hourly wage for this position is $124,560.00 - $236,650.00.”*

**General Description of Available Benefits for Eligible Employees of Truist Financial Corporation:** All regular teammates (not temporary or contingent workers) working 20 hours or more per week are eligible for benefits, though eligibility for specific benefits may be determined by the division of Truist offering the position. Truist offers medical, dental, vision, life insurance, disability, accidental death and dismemberment, tax-preferred savings accounts, and a 401k plan to teammates. Teammates also receive no less than 10 days of vacation (prorated based on date of hire and by full-time or part-time status) during their first year of employment, along with 10 sick days (also prorated), and paid holidays. For more details on Truist’s generous benefit plans, please visit our Benefits site. Depending on the position and division, this job may also be eligible for Truist’s defined benefit pension plan, restricted stock units, and/or a deferred compensation plan. As you advance through the hiring process, you will also learn more about the specific benefits available for any non-temporary position for which you apply, based on full-time or part-time status, position, and division of work.

***Truist supports a diverse workforce and is an Equal Opportunity Employer that does not discriminate against individuals on the basis of race, gender, color, religion, citizenship or national origin, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, veteran status or other classification protected by law. Truist is a Drug Free Workplace.***

title: Cocinero
description:

Trabajar en Sodexo es más que un trabajo; es una oportunidad de ser parte de algo más grande. porque creemos que nuestras acciones diarias tienen un gran impacto. Pertenecerá a una empresa y un equipo que le valoran por ser usted; actuará con propósito y tendrá un impacto a través de sus acciones diarias; y podrá prosperar a su manera.

 **Lo que ofrecemos:**

* Puede estar disponible una gama completa de beneficios que incluyen tiempo libre pagado; vacaciones; seguro médico, dental y oftalmológico; reembolso de matrícula; 401k y más\\*
* Ambiente de trabajo flexible y dinámico
* Compensación competitiva
* Acceso a programas continuos de capacitación y desarrollo
* Innumerables oportunidades para crecer dentro de la empresa
* Elegible para bonificación: Varies by location
* Asignación de comida: Yes
* Uniforme proporcionado: Yes
* Transporte público: Close to public transportation and available parking

* *En general, Sodexo se esfuerza por tener paquetes de beneficios integrales consistentes y descripciones detalladas de los puestos que los candidatos solicitan. Sin embargo, debido a la naturaleza contractual de nuestro negocio, algunos beneficios, incluido el costo y las funciones laborales, pueden variar ligeramente según la unidad en la que trabaje. Asegúrese de pedirle a su entrevistador información adicional específica de la ubicación durante el proceso de la entrevista.*

* *En general, Sodexo se esfuerza por ofrecer paquetes integrales de beneficios para empleados y descripciones detalladas de los puestos que los candidatos solicitan. Sin embargo, debido a la naturaleza contractual de nuestro negocio, algunas de las funciones laborales y beneficios de los empleados pueden variar según la unidad a la que se postule. Los criterios de elegibilidad y/o ciertos beneficios que se ofrecen a nuestros empleados pueden variar según la unidad, incluido el costo de los beneficios y su disponibilidad. Pídale a su entrevistador información adicional específica de la ubicación durante el proceso de entrevista, como sus funciones laborales y los beneficios para empleados que se ofrecen en la unidad.*

  

El Cook preparará, dividirá en porciones, cocinará y presentará con precisión y eficiencia una variedad de alimentos fríos y calientes para varios períodos de comida: para incluir desayuno, almuerzo, cena y eventos especiales/servicio de comidas. Estas responsabilidades pueden diferir entre cuentas, según las necesidades comerciales y los requisitos del cliente.

Working with Sodexo is more than a job; it’s a chance to be part of something greater. You’ll belong in a company and team that values you for you; you’ll act with purpose and have an impact through your everyday actions; and you’ll be able to thrive in your own way.

title: Personal Banker
description:
Responsibilities include, but are not limited to:
* Responsible for providing exceptional customer service in accordance with Valley's mission statement. Ability to engage customers with friendly and professional service.
* Knowledge of all Bank products and services and ability to educate and demonstrate customers on such, as well as cross sell various products and services.
* Ability to present a confident and professional demeanor to establish trust and gain knowledge from the customer. Analyze needs and recommend appropriate products and services.
* Meets with customers to analyze financial needs and maximize sales opportunities. Offers all bank products and assists with other service needs, opens new accounts, i.e., checking, savings, certificate of deposit and IRAs, discusses/sells loan products to existing and prospective customers and possesses knowledge of on-line banking and mobile banking abilities to promote and demonstrate to customers.
* Responsible for meeting customer expectations and achieving service quality standards. Participates/oversees the sales referral process ensuring customer financial needs are met and assists management in coaching and mentoring branch staff members.
* Ability to perform all transactions required by a customer and use appropriate technology to provide services most effectively and efficiently. Maintain and balance a cash box. Ability to utilize technology such as Teller Scanning Equipment, Cash Recycling and Cash Dispensing machines and support customers in the use of Coin Machines.
* Act as Vault Teller ensuring adequacy of Branch cash for daily transactions by assisting the branch staff in ordering and shipping currency - coin and controlling - distributing cash to Tellers in prescribed limits.
* Assists in community events (i.e., Habitat for Humanity) etc. Participates in and supports CRA initiatives, activities and programs.
* Report all significant matters, issues and unusual customer activity to Manager maintaining personal knowledge of compliance and regulatory requirements.
* Maintains knowledge and compliance with the Bank's Code of Conduct and all policies and procedures.

Requirements:
**Required Skills:**
* Excellent verbal and written communication. Ability to write correspondence and appropriately and accurately demonstrate products and services to customers.

title: Restaurant Crew Member - $17/hr
description:
**We’d love to have you at our table–join us in reimagining home dining!**




**About the Role**


At Wonder, we want to make world-class food within reach, no matter where you live. As a Line Cook, you are a key part of that by creating delicious food for our customers, while getting to work with various cuisines from menus created by our famous Michelin-starred and Celebrity Chefs.

 **Role Details**

* Pay Rate: $17.00
Job Location: Midland Park  
* 

  

**Responsibilities**

* Cook food items according to recipes and Wonder standards
* Assist in maintaining and setting up kitchen stations
* Keep the kitchen neat, clean, and orderly
* Ensure proper food labeling and storage, following Food Safety and Hazard Analysis Critical Control Point (HACCP) guidelines
* Perform inventory checks and logging, ensure accuracy in inventory control by scanning items in and out
* Monitor and ensure food is within temperature standards
* Operate efficiently in a fast-paced environment
* Other duties as assigned

 **Qualifications**

* At least 6 months of kitchen experience in a quick service restaurant or similar food prep setting
* Accuracy and speed in executing tasks
* Following directions and instructions promptly and accurately
* Exhibits effective verbal communication skills
* Ability to thrive in a fast-paced environment
* Strong team player
* Strong knowledge of food safety and sanitation practices

 **Requirements**

* Must be 18 years old and legally authorized to work in the US
* Must be able to lift 50 pounds
* Must be able to stand for a full shift while working
* Must have weekend availability
* *This list of qualifications and requirements also reflects the qualifications and requirements used as vetting criteria for our AEDT (Automated Employment Decision Tool)*

 **Benefits**

* Medical, Dental, and Vision Insurance
* 100% employer-paid Life Insurance
* 401(k) Retirement Plan
* Employer match for Health Savings Account (HSA)
* 1.5x Pay rate on company holidays
* Learning and Development opportunities to advance your career
* Employee Stock
* Employee Discount

*Note: Some of our benefits vary by state and depend on the number of hours you work.*

 **About Us**


Imagine: 30 unique restaurants to order from, brought to your door in under 30 minutes. That’s what our customers experience.


At Wonder, we want to make world-class food within reach, no matter where you live. That’s why we’ve created a vertically integrated, new standard of dining that will allow you to enjoy menus from award-winning chefs and iconic restaurants across the country, all in one place. Our elevated brick + mortar locations will offer pick up and dine in options, as well as delivery to your home.


As a food-tech startup backed by top-tier venture capitalists and led by a team of experienced entrepreneurs—including some of the most accomplished leaders in the technology, culinary, and logistics industries—we’re growing. Join us in pioneering a new category of dining called “Fast-Fine”, and revolutionizing the way people eat.

 *An AEDT (Automated Employment Decision Tool) is employed in the assessment of applicants for the positions being recruited for in order to gauge the following pertinent qualifications or traits:*

* *The candidate’s ability to perform the tasks in the available job role.*
* *The candidate's self-rated skill proficiency.*
* *The candidate’s fit for this job posting.*

*More information about the type, source, and retention policy relating to data collected for the AEDT can be found on the privacy policy* *here**.* *We retain your personal information for as long as is necessary to manage your application for and employment with the Company and in accordance with our data retention schedule. We may retain your personal information for longer if it is necessary to comply with our legal or reporting obligations (for example, if we are required to retain your data to comply with applicable laws), resolve disputes, enforce our legal agreements and policies, address other legitimate business needs, or as permitted or required by applicable law. We may also retain your personal information in a deidentified or aggregated form so that it can no longer be associated with you. To determine the appropriate retention period for your personal information, we consider various factors such as the amount, nature, and sensitivity of your information; the potential risk of unauthorized access, use or disclosure; the purposes for which we collect or process your personal information; and applicable legal requirements. Personal information does not include certain categories of information, such as publicly available information from government records, personal information you make available to the public, and deidentified or aggregated information.*

***A final note***

*At Wonder we believe that in order to build the best team, we must hire using an objective lens. We are committed to fair hiring practices where we hire people for their potential and advocate for diversity, equity, and inclusion. As such, we do not discriminate or make decisions based on your race, color, religion, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, age, military service eligibility, veteran status, marital status, disability, or any other protected class. If you have a disability, please let us know how we can make your interview process work best for you.*

title: Sales Associate
description:
Welcome to Bob’s Discount Furniture, where professionalism meets **fun**, and every day is an opportunity to shine!

As a Retail Guest Experience Specialist, you’ll be at the forefront of Bob’s success story, helping us maintain our position as a leader in the industry. Our commitment to the "Bob’s Way" means delivering unparalleled customer service without the gimmicks, ensuring each shopper enjoys a transparent and enjoyable shopping journey.

Our founder, Bob Kaufman, said it best: "No phony sales, no phony gimmicks, just everyday low prices and value! We call it the Bob’s Way because no one does it better!"

**Here’s what you can expect from us:**

* Competitive Hourly Advance/Draw vs. Commission pay structure with bonus potential.
* Comprehensive health, dental, and vision coverage for peace of mind.
* Generous 401(k) Profit Sharing Plan with a company match.
* Paid time off including vacation, sick days, holidays, and yes, even your birthday!
* Employee Assistance Program for additional support when needed.
* Generous employee discount because we believe in making your home as comfortable as your workplace.

**Your Responsibilities Will Include:**

* Greeting and engaging customers to understand their home furnishing needs and offering tailored solutions.
* Providing world-class customer service, ensuring each shopper enjoys a memorable and satisfying experience.
* Building rapport with clients through exceptional product knowledge and attentive listening skills.
* Developing and maintaining a loyal customer base through effective networking and follow-up.
* Generating sales through a consultative, low-pressure approach that emphasizes value and customer satisfaction.

**What We’re Looking For:**

* Energetic, self-motivated sales professionals with outstanding interpersonal and communication skills.

* 401(k) matching
* Dental insurance
* Employee discount

title: Entry Level Office Assistant for Early Childhood Education
description:
Smart Start Academy is dedicated to providing high-quality early childhood education in a nurturing and supportive environment. We are seeking a motivated and organized Office Assistant to join our team and support the smooth operation of our center. This position involves managing office tasks, supporting staff, maintaining records, and providing excellent customer service to parents, staff, and children. The ideal candidate will be organized, detail-oriented, and have a passion for early childhood education.

**Key Responsibilities:**

* **Administrative Support:**
* Manage front desk operations, including answering phones, greeting visitors, and handling inquiries.
* Maintain accurate and up-to-date records, including student files, attendance records, and staff files.
* Coordinate and schedule appointments, meetings, and events.

**Communication:**

* Communicate effectively with staff, parents, and external agencies.
* Distribute newsletters, announcements, and other communication materials.

**Financial Management:**

* Handle billing and invoicing for tuition and other fees.
* Manage petty cash and reconcile accounts.
* Assist with budget preparation and monitoring.

**Enrollment and Registration:**

* Ensure all necessary documentation is completed and filed appropriately.

**Office Management:**

* Order and maintain office supplies and equipment.
* Ensure the office area is clean, organized, and welcoming.
* Oversee maintenance and repair of office equipment.

**Compliance and Record Keeping:**

* Ensure compliance with all local, state, and federal regulations.
* Maintain confidentiality of all records and information.
* Prepare and submit required reports and documentation.

**Support to Staff:**

* Assist teachers and staff with administrative tasks as needed.
* Coordinate staff schedules and handle substitute arrangements.
* Support the onboarding process for new staff members.

**Qualifications:**

* High school diploma or equivalent
* Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, Outlook).
* Excellent organizational and multitasking skills.
* Strong written and verbal communication skills.
* Ability to maintain confidentiality and handle sensitive information.
* Friendly and professional demeanor.

**Physical Requirements:**

* Ability to sit for extended periods.
* Ability to lift and carry office supplies and equipment as needed (up to 20 pounds).

**Work Schedule:**

* Part-Time - Full-time, Monday to Friday

**Compensation:**

* Salary commensurate with experience.
* Benefits package includes health insurance, a retirement plan, and paid time off.

title: instructor
description:
Arch Amenities Group, the world's leading spa, fitness and leisure firm, is seeking a Youth Program Director. The Youth Program Director will work with the Youth Activities Coordinator in the implementation of youth programs. The Youth Program Director will be responsible for keeping staff and student records up to licensing standards as well as managing the budget for the program and staff payroll. Should possess a willingness to try new tasks, generates new ideas for change, evaluates and recognizes priorities, keeps current and integrates new information, communicate and acts as a role model and mentor for counselors and nursery staff.





**Responsibilities:**


* Ensures the “Arch Amenities Group Experience” for members and guests by maintaining the standards set in AAG Basics to Excellence (BTE), Mission Statement/Values; Standards and Expectations, and Brand Standards.
* Adheres to policies of the facility and AAG.
* Oversees a Licensed Day Center in the state of Virginia
* Produces schedules for employees.
* Completes monthly board report.
* Prepares and edits marketing material for the after school program, summer camp and nursery.
* Tracks the budget numbers and expectations.
* Payroll.
* Creates weekly schedules for students and parents.
* Authors a monthly newsletter for the after school program.
* Orders supplies for the program.
* Responsible for the safety and well being of all attendees to the after school program, summer camp and nursery.
* Orders supplies for the programs.
* Implements activity programs as planned and assigned to meet the functional levels, needs and interests of each participant.
* Maintains good rapport with family and participants.
* Communicates with participants, participant's families, and staff.
* Drives the facilities bus as needed.
* Attends in-service and continuing education programs in order to maintain employment in a State of Virginia Licensed Child Day Center.
* Work special events that the facility holds.
* Hold regular staff meeting and trainings.


**Qualifications:**


* 21 years of age or older.
* Self motivated.
* Organized and goal oriented.
* Previous experience working with children.
* Ability to oversee and manage.
* Demonstrates active listening techniques, gains support through effective relationships, treats others with dignity and respect and seeks feedback.
* Adheres to the State Licensing Requirements for Child Day Centers.
* Maintains a clean driving record in order to be on the insurance for driving the bus.
* CPR and first aid certified.
* Hold MAT and DHO certifications.
* Education Requirements: Bachelor's degree in a child-related field such as, but not limited to, elementary education, nursing, or recreation from a college or university and one year or more of programmatic experience preferred.


Arch Amenities Group is an equal employment opportunity employer that is committed to having a diverse and inclusive workforce.

title: Installer
description:

* Perfecto trabajo de medio tiempo!!
* Posibilidad de crear su propio horario - ¡FLEXIBILIDAD!
* Formación completa y certificación.

ShelfGenie está buscando un socio de instalación que ya sea un artesano experimentado. Esta es una excelente oportunidad para carpinteros, remodeladores de cocinas/baños y personal de mantenimiento que buscan trabajo adicional.




**La experiencia ShelfGenie:** nuestro objetivo es brindar la mejor experiencia a nuestros clientes. Los instaladores de ShelfGenie trabajan en estrecha colaboración con el diseñador/vendedor de ShelfGenie para ayudar a garantizar la satisfacción del cliente.




**Cree su propio horario:** le traemos los clientes que compran. A partir de ahí, los instaladores de ShelfGenie programan citas de medición e instalación que se ajustan a la disponibilidad del cliente.




**Capacitación y soporte:** cada instalador se somete a una capacitación inicial para garantizar los estándares de instalación de la marca. Oportunidades de desarrollo profesional disponibles de forma continua.




**Compensación:** a los instaladores se les paga un porcentaje de cada trabajo instalado. Si bien no existe una garantía de ingresos por hora, las ganancias promedio son de $30 a $60 por hora. Los instaladores más rápidos y experimentados pueden superar los $100/hora.


**Responsabilidades:**

* Reciba alertas de empleo por correo electrónico y programe una cita con el cliente
* Subir medidas al sistema del portal informático
* Inspeccione los productos por calidad
* Tome medidas precisas y cárguelas en el sistema del portal informático
* Recibir e inspeccionar productos para garantizar la calidad.
* Instale estanterías Glide-Out en la casa del cliente a satisfacción del cliente
* Interactuar con los clientes de una manera profesional y amigable.
* Seguir las normas y reglamentos de seguridad establecidos y mantener un entorno seguro y limpio.




**Calificaciones:**

* Experiencia previa como manitas/mantenimiento general
* Licencias y seguros estatales necesarios
* Valorar la importancia del servicio al cliente
* Confiable, profesional, rápido, motivado, organizado y ejercita una buena gestión del tiempo.
* Transporte hacia y desde el lugar de trabajo
* Conocimiento de las normas y reglamentos de seguridad en el lugar de trabajo (OSHA)
* Conocimiento de métodos, herramientas y equipos utilizados en carpintería.
company_description: Since 2000, we’ve been turning our clients’ frustration with their homes into blissful happiness. We pride ourselves on having the best quality Glide-Out shelves available to homeowners.

title: Client Services Director
description:
As client services director, you will lead a team of HR professionals to provide services to Empowered Hospitality clients. You will be responsible for initiating, building and sustaining relationships, architecting and delivering leading HR solutions, supporting the development of our team, meeting financial targets, and contributing to the strategic growth of our firm. Prior experience in a consultative role, managing a P&L, liaising with senior-level executives, and managing projects is essential for this role, in addition to an understanding and appreciation of general HR principles, strategies and tactics. You must also bring tireless curiosity, exceptional attention to detail and unblemished professional ethics and integrity to our firm.

**Core Competencies**

* Distilling complex concepts into impactful communications, tools and processes
* Foreseeing and proactively offering solutions to common business challenges
* Exercising exceptional PowerPoint, Excel, and written communication skills to execute flawless executive-level deliverables
* Understanding and analyzing an organization’s current state and communicating opportunities for improvement
* Leading, inspiring and influencing team members and clients
* Providing structure and oversight to ensure excellent project execution

**Responsibilities**

* Managing project scope, staffing and budget for a portfolio of clients
* Steering strategy and action plans in collaboration with project teams
* Cultivating accountability for attention to detail and risk management
* Attending client meetings to review project deliverables, answer questions, and discuss opportunities
* Providing regular client status reports
* Proactively escalating potential concerns or issues
* Nurturing new and existing relationships to expand our network, strengthen our brand, and identify prospective clients

**Experience & Education**

* 5+ years’ experience in management consulting, client relations or consultative sales role, demonstrating strategic thinking, executive-level communication and senior relationship management skills
* 5+ years’ experience in human resources (recruiting, training, benefits, etc.)
* 5+ years’ experience in hospitality management preferred
* Experience building, leading and developing high-functioning teams
* Exceptional MS office skills
* Strong business and financial acumen, and problem-solving skills
* Bachelor’s degree required; human resources, business administration, or related field preferred
* Master’s degree preferred
* SHRM-CP, SHRM-SCP, SPHR, PMP, or other related certification preferred

**What's in it for you?**

* Compensation: $120-180k + incentive compensation
* Vacation: Two weeks PTO + 10 company holidays
* Healthcare: Medical, Dental and Vision coverage
* Retirement & financial: 401(k) with employer match; pre-tax commuter, medical and childcare benefits; monthly cell phone and internet reimbursement; laptop and home office reimbursement
* Lifestyle support: Work-from-home flexibility; monthly coworking stipend; team-building events; tuition reimbursement; employee recognition program

**About us**

At Empowered Hospitality, we create workplaces where people thrive. Our HR and Talent solutions were designed to support hospitality companies of all sizes. We help our clients create workplaces that foster inclusion, positivity, and growth - and then find great people to work there. Because in hospitality, when your people thrive, your business thrives.

Follow Empowered Hospitality on LinkedIn to stay up to date with our newest career opportunities, HR news, and industry highlights.

title: Postdoctoral Research Associate/The Julis-Rabinowitz Center for Public Policy and Finance (JRCPPF)
description:
The Julis-Rabinowitz Center for Public Policy and Finance (JRCPPF) at the Princeton School of Public and International Affairs seeks candidates for a postdoctoral research associate, or more senior research position. The anticipated start date is September 1, 2025.
The primary criteria are the quality of the applicant's research on the linkages between finance and macroeconomics broadly. The candidate's work may use empirical or theoretical methods to address important policy questions. The position provides an outstanding opportunity for independent research as well as opportunities for collaboration with Princeton faculty, graduate and undergraduate students. There are no teaching obligations.
Postdoctoral Research or more senior research associates are expected to participate actively in the intellectual activities of Princeton University. Applicants must have received a Ph.D., preferably within the last 2 years (or expected by September 2025. The Term of appointment is based on rank. Positions at the postdoctoral rank are for one year with the possibility of renewal pending satisfactory performance and continued funding; those hired at more senior ranks may have multi-year appointments.
Applicants must apply online at https://www.princeton.edu/acad-positions/position/36284 and submit a cover letter, C.V., one or at most two research papers, and three reference letters. This position is subject to the University's background check policy. The work location for this position is in-person on campus at Princeton University.
The Princeton School of Public and International Affairs is especially interested in candidates who, through their research, teaching and service, will contribute to the diversity and excellence of the academic community. We actively seek colleagues of exceptional ability who represent a broad range of viewpoints, experience and value systems and who share Princeton University's dedication to excellence and service.
company_description: Princeton University is a vibrant community of scholarship and learning that stands in the nation's service and the service of humanity.

title: Employment Litigation Associate
description:
Employment Litigation Associate

Faruqi & Faruqi, LLP is a national law firm focused on complex civil litigation.

The Firm seeks an Associate with two (2) to six (6) years of experience to join the Employment Practice Group, Faruqi & Faruqi Manhattan office. The Group specializes in litigating discrimination/retaliation cases, as well as wage and hour class and collective actions. The Associate will conduct legal research, draft pleadings and various motions, respond to discovery demands, and assist senior associates and partners with all aspects of employment litigation.

Must Have Qualifications: JD from an ABA-accredited Law School. Admitted to practice law in the state of New York. Strong research and writing skills are required. Only resumes with GPAs will be considered.

Base compensation ranges from $135,000 to $165,000, commensurate with experience.

title: Automotive Customer Service Advisor
description:
**Position Summary**



Contribute to the growth of the organization across all lines of business through customer engagement, expert product and service knowledge, follow-up, and follow through at the service desk, on the sales floor, and at the register.


**Duties & Responsibilities**

* First point of contact for customers on the phone and in the store. Responsible for engaging customers, scheduling appointments, building trust, understanding needs, communicating processes and timelines, and selling parts and service that make the customer's car run at peak efficiency; adheres to Company Customer Care standards to meet customer expectations.
* Responsible for the organization and productivity of the service business through work order and register transactions, thorough vehicle inspections, and service and replacement part knowledge.
* Under the direction of Management, assists in various aspects of customer care, work order and register assistance, facility maintenance, and Outside Purchase (OP) ordering.
* Follow all policies and procedures related to cash, credit, check, refund and return policies. Works with the management team to react to customer service issues, customer complaints, and/or business opportunities.
* Conduct and participate in routine express automotive services, including tire mounting, balancing, rotations, and repair; oil changes, fluid top-offs, lubrications, filter and bulb replacement; battery installation, starting and charging system testing; cosmetic car services, and thorough vehicle inspection.
* Primary driving force behind the implementation and constant execution of safety procedures, ensuring wheel torque and oil/fluid services are performed per standard operating procedure directives.
* Partner with Management to produce a safe and health work environment that complies with all local, state, and federal laws, as well as with company policies and procedures.
* Effectively communicate with all associates, management, and customers; interprets and retains information and applies knowledge appropriately.
* In designated locations, may be a secondary key carrier responsible for basic and detailed opening and closing responsibilities.
* Maintain an organized and neat shop.
* Adhere to all company policies, procedures, safety and environmental rules.
* Other duties as assigned.


**Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities**


* High school diploma or equivalent required.
* Valid Driver's License.
* One year of related experience in the automotive service environment.
* One year of sales experience preferred.
* Must have basic knowledge and understanding of mathematical concepts such as addition, subtraction, multiplication, division, percentages, and fractions. Ability to apply mathematical formulas to calculate commissions and discounts.
* Strong verbal communication skills.
* Strong customer service skills.
* Ability to work Days, Nights, Weekends, Holidays.

  

  

**Physical Demands/Work Environment**



The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.


The characteristics described here are representative of those an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this job.

title: Team Member
description:
**PURPOSE OF YOUR WORK**


At Checkers & Rally’s we make a difference in people’s lives by serving our Franchisees, Teams, and Guests. As a member of the team you will be responsible for helping ensure we are 1st Choice for our Guests. Team Members will passionately serve our Guests, by providing excellent Guest service and fast, BOLD food!

 **HOW YOU MAKE A DIFFERENCE EVERYDAY**

* Building sales and profits by promoting Guest satisfaction
* Escalating any concerns or recommendations to the General Manager
* Identifying and responding to Guests’ needs
* Completing cross-training and certification in multiple positions
* Adhering to policy and procedures to maximize Guest and employee satisfaction
* Helping ensure the restaurant is a safe, clean and fun environment for our employees and Guests!

 **YOU'VE GOT THIS?**

* Guest service or food preparation experience
* Basic math skills
* Ability to work flexible schedule and extended hours
* High energy to keep up with our fast paced environment
* Commitment to our core values of integrity, service, excellence, and courage to be bold & grow
* High School Diploma or General Education Degree (GED) - Preferred
* Food Safety Certified - Preferred

 **WHAT’S IN IT FOR YOU?**

* **Operations Excellence:** Our team expects and delivers nothing but the best
* **Training & Development:** We bring out the best by ensuring everyone gets well trained
* **Personal & Career Growth**: You can do more, get more, and be more at Checkers & Rally’s
* **Benefits & Rewards:** As a Team Member, you will be eligible for the Employee Assistance Program (EAP) as of your first day. Eligibility for the 401(k) plan goes into effect after 1 year of service. You can also earn Team Member bonuses!

 **As you grow with the organization, your benefit offerings grows as well!**

title: IUS Manager
description:
**Job Overview:**





The IUS Manager at The Galaxy Condominiums is responsible for the management of In-Unit Services departmental functions and personnel.

  

**Your Responsibilities:**





* Effectively train IUS and technical staff in the administration of the work-order process, as well as the completion of all work-orders within each unit.
* Supervise IUS Administrator's work.
* Manage customer service interaction with Residents relating to IUS work orders.
* Follow and enforce IUS procedure to better maintain customer service and effective repair and upkeep within residential units.
* Review Alteration and Decoration Agreements and manage completion and submittal process for all work being done by Owners or their contractors within their respective units.
* Ensure pre/post inspections for Alteration and Decoration work being done throughout the complex, as needed.
* Maintain available inventory as needed to timely complete IUS work-orders requests.
* Inform technicians of type and location of work to be performed and dispatch technicians accordingly.
* Coordinate IUS personnel staff scheduling with Planned Companies Maintenance Supervisor.
* Manage the receipt of verbal requests for work in units.
* Manage the IUS work-order completion process and ensure follow-up with IUS Billing Coordinator.
* Coordinate with outside vendors for the completion of work-orders that fall outside of the skills or capabilities of IUS technical staff and ensure proper billback.
* Coordinate with Risk Management after a water loss to mitigate damages and schedule necessary repairs.
* Audit IUS policies, procedures and offer recommendations to modify same to the Facilities and Operation Manager to better maintain overall service.
* Address any concerns that residents have with any issues regarding their unit, maintenance technician or work-orders.
* Schedule work-orders according to urgency.
* Maintain records of all repairs, Decoration Agreements, Alteration Agreements and leak trace efforts.
* Document and prepare progress reports and maintenance logs.
* Call or write customer to ensure satisfactory performance of service.
* Maintain and file documentation as required.
* Create and print memos, correspondence, reports, and other documents when necessary.
* Perform customer service functions.
* Perform other clerical duties as needed, such as filing, photocopying, and collating.
* Provide appropriate and accurate information to visitors and residents.





**Skills & Qualifications:**





* Analytical skills and an eye for detail.
* Numerical and budgeting skills.
* Planning and organizational skills.
* Ability to understand broader business issues.
* Communication and presentation skills.
* Bachelor's Degree in Business, Real Estate, Accounting or related studies.
* 5 years' expertise in Construction or Real Estate Property Management.

  

**Physical Requirements:**





* Capable of working extended hours, to include evenings, weekends and holidays as necessary.
* Able to see well enough to read faint or partially obscured writing or printing, with corrective lenses as needed.
* Must be able to speak English in a clear and understandable voice so that various types of communications may be conducted with people of various levels of education and capabilities, to include the exchange and receipt of information over the telephone.
* Position involves sitting, standing (for long periods of time), stooping, kneeling, pushing, shoving, lifting, carrying and moving objects that can weigh up to 50 lbs. This movement can occur throughout the day. Must also be able to climb several flights of stairs if necessary.
* Must have finger dexterity for typing/using a keyboard.

  

**Environmental Requirements:**





* Must be able to work on more than one assignment at a time with frequent interruptions, changes and delays. Must be able to remain focused and work effectively, efficiently, and cheerfully under such circumstances. For safety reasons, employee must remain alert to working conditions and aware of safety, health, and environmental concerns.
* Must be able to work effectively and cheerfully in an environment which may be stressful due to adversarial situations resulting from the proper performance of duties.

  

**Supervisory Responsibilities:**





Directly supervises the IUS Department and technical personnel. Carries out supervisory responsibilities in accordance with the organization's policies and applicable laws. Responsibilities include training employees; planning, assigning, and directing work; appraising performance; rewarding and disciplining employees; addressing complaints and resolving problems.





**What We Offer**As a full-time exempt associate, you will be eligible for full comprehensive benefits to include your choice of multiple medical plans, dental, and vision. In addition, you will be eligible for time off benefits, paid holidays and a 401k with company match. Occasional travel may be required to attend training and other company functions.
**Compensation****:** $60,000 - $70,000 / annually

title: Account Manager
description:
ACCOUNT MANAGER:

Are you a dynamic individual with a passion for sales and business development? Join our team as an Account Manager and play a pivotal role in driving growth and success!

JOB SUMMARY:

As an Account Manager, you will be responsible for nurturing client relationships, identifying business opportunities, and achieving sales targets. Your primary focus will be on analyzing market trends, communicating effectively with clients, and utilizing Salesforce to manage accounts efficiently.

DUTIES:

* Develop and maintain strong relationships with clients to understand their needs and provide tailored solutions.
* Drive business development initiatives to expand the client base and increase revenue.
* Utilize Salesforce to track sales activities, manage leads, and forecast future opportunities.
* Lead warm calling campaigns to generate new leads and convert prospects into clients.
* Collaborate with the sales team to strategize on account management approaches and achieve collective goals.

EXPEREINCE:

* Proven experience in sales, preferably in technology sales or related fields.
* Proficiency in analyzing market trends and identifying growth opportunities.
* Strong communication skills to effectively engage with clients and internal teams.
* Demonstrated leadership abilities to drive initiatives and meet sales targets.
* Ability to analyze data, create reports, and present findings to stakeholders.

BENEFITS:

* Competitive salary package with performance-based incentives.
* Opportunities for career growth and professional development.
* Collaborative work environment that values teamwork and innovation.
* Access to training programs to enhance skills and knowledge in the industry.

REQUIREMENTS:

* Experience in sales or account management roles.
* Strong analytical skills to interpret market data and drive strategic decisions.
* Excellent communication skills for effective client interactions.
* Proactive attitude towards business development initiatives.

Join our team of dedicated professionals who are passionate about driving success through strategic account management. If you are a results-driven individual with a knack for analyzing markets and fostering client relationships, we invite you to apply for the Account Manager position!

title: Oracle EBS Technical Developer
description:
**Job Title: Oracle EBS Technical Developer**

**Location:** **New York City**

**Job Type:** **6+ months**

**Job Summary:**

* We are seeking a highly skilled Oracle EBS Technical Developer with solid procurement experience to join our IT team.
* The ideal candidate will have extensive expertise in Oracle E-Business Suite (EBS), particularly within the Procurement module.
* You will play a crucial role in designing, developing, and maintaining Oracle EBS applications with a focus on procurement processes, ensuring that procurement systems are efficient, reliable, and tailored to our business needs.

**Key Responsibilities:**

* **Procurement Customization & Development:** Design, develop, and customize Oracle EBS Procurement applications, including Purchase Orders, Sourcing, Supplier Management, and Procurement Contracts. Utilize Oracle Forms, Oracle Reports, PL/SQL, and Oracle Application Framework (OAF) to tailor solutions to procurement needs.
* **Technical Support:** Provide expert technical support for Oracle EBS Procurement modules, addressing and resolving issues related to purchase requisitions, purchase orders, supplier management, and procurement contracts.
* **Integration:** Develop and maintain seamless integration between Oracle EBS Procurement and other systems using Oracle Integration Cloud (OIC), REST/SOAP web services, and other integration technologies.
* **Performance Tuning:** Analyze, optimize, and tune SQL queries, PL/SQL procedures, and application performance specifically within the procurement module to ensure high system efficiency and reliability.
* **Documentation:** Create and maintain comprehensive technical documentation related to procurement processes, including design specifications, functional requirements, and user guides.
* **Testing & Quality Assurance:** Conduct unit testing and collaborate with QA teams to ensure the accuracy and quality of procurement-related customizations and solutions.
* **Collaboration:** Engage with procurement functional consultants, business users, and other stakeholders to understand and translate procurement requirements into effective technical solutions.
* **Upgrade & Patch Management:** Assist with Oracle EBS Procurement upgrades, patches, and maintenance to ensure the system remains stable and up-to-date with the latest Oracle releases.

**Qualifications:**

* **Education:** Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field. Relevant Oracle EBS certifications with a focus on Procurement are highly desirable.
* **Experience:** Minimum of 3+ years of experience as an Oracle EBS Technical Developer, with solid, hands-on experience in the Oracle EBS Procurement module
* **Skills:**
* Extensive experience with Oracle EBS Procurement modules, including Purchase Orders, Sourcing, Supplier Management, and Procurement Contracts.
* Strong proficiency in SQL, PL/SQL, Oracle Forms, Oracle Reports, and Oracle Application Framework (OAF).
* Proven experience with Oracle Integration Cloud (OIC) and web services for system integration.
* In-depth understanding of Oracle EBS architecture, data models, and customization best practices specific to procurement.
* Excellent problem-solving abilities and meticulous attention to detail.
* Strong communication and interpersonal skills, with a demonstrated ability to work effectively in a collaborative team environment.

Job Type: Contract

Pay: $55.00 - $60.00 per hour

Application Question(s):

* Are you willing to go for onsite?
* Are you willing to work on W2?
* Are you a US Citizen or GC or H1B?

Experience:

* procurement: 8 years (Required)
* Oracle EBS: 8 years (Required)

* New York, NY (Required)

title: Warehouse Data Entry Associate
description:
**COMPANY OVERVIEW**

Since 2002, Mason Technologies has been a leader in technology integration, proudly certified as a Woman-owned Business Enterprise (WBE) both in NYC and nationally. With headquarters and a fully equipped warehouse in Deer Park, NY, an additional office in downtown NYC, and resources across the nation, we design, implement, and service innovative solutions in low-voltage structured cabling, audio visual systems, data centers, and unified security.

We serve a variety of industries including healthcare, government, higher education, finance, and business (both big and small). We're always aiming to build lasting relationships based on trust, respect, and a shared vision for a better future. Our founder, Jennifer Mason, has cultivated a family-like environment that emphasizes deep care and commitment to our people and the clients and communities we serve, forming the foundation of everything we do.

At Mason Technologies, diversity and inclusion drive our hiring, ensuring we bring together the most talented individuals regardless of race, age, religion, gender identification, or sexual orientation. If you want to have a career of unparalleled growth, a team with a family-strong bond, and an unmatched atmosphere of motivated and caring professionals, apply to Mason today!

Let’s craft a future together that's built upon integrity, equality, professional pride, the authentic spirit of our family, and a commitment to making the world a better place.

**Our Comprehensive Employee Benefit and Perk Package**:

· **Medical, Dental, and Vision Coverage:** Comprehensive healthcare benefits to keep you and your family healthy and secure.

· **401k with Matching:** Plan for your future with our 401k program, featuring competitive company matching.

· **Paid Time Off (Holiday/Vacation/Sick/Personal):** Generous PTO to ensure a healthy work-life balance and time for relaxation and personal needs.

· **Unlimited Growth Opportunities:** We believe in fostering talent and providing opportunities for continuous professional growth.

· **Family-Friendly Company Events & Outings:** We host regular events and outings to foster a family-friendly atmosphere and build team camaraderie, like our Warehouse Jam Sessions and Holiday Parties!

· **Bagel Thursdays & Friday Lunch Catering:** Enjoy weekly treats with Bagel Thursdays and Friday Lunch catering at our offices!

· **Caring Ownership:** We believe in mutual dedication. If you're committed to Mason Technologies, we are equally committed to you. We prioritize the well-being of our employees and their families, ensuring a supportive and caring work environment.

**Job Description**

· Perform inventory transfers and adjustments using ConnectWise software to maintain accurate stock levels.

· Execute picking and shipping tasks in ConnectWise software to ensure timely and accurate order fulfillment.

· Verify items and quantities against shipping documents to ensure accuracy.

· Generate and review general reports related to inventory, shipments, and warehouse performance.

· Assist in the analysis of data to support decision-making and operational improvements.

· Assisting with general administrative warehouse tasks

· Maintain a clean and organized work environment to promote safety and efficiency.

**Qualifications:**

· High school diploma or equivalent required; additional relevant certification is a plus.

· Proven experience in data entry.

· Excellent computer skills including Microsoft Excel and the rest of the Office Suite.

· Warehouse experience is preferred.

· Proficiency in using ConnectWise or similar inventory management software.

· Strong attention to detail and accuracy in data entry and reporting.

· Ability to handle multiple tasks and work in a fast-paced environment.

· Good organizational and time-management skills.

· Excellent communication and teamwork abilities.

· Ability to lift and move up to 50 pounds as needed.

title: Guest Service/Sales Associate
description:
**Position Overview:**



Turn your passion for taking care of others into a rewarding role with the growing team at EWC Growth! The prime responsibility of a Guest Service Associate is creating an exceptional guest experience, achieving sales goals, and willingness to initiate genuine conversation and recommendations with our guests on European Wax Center services and products.


**Benefits:**


* We are committed to recognizing your exceptional performance with earnings ranging from $17.50 to $25.00 or more per hour. Our compensation structure includes a $17.50 base pay complemented by commissions and incentives, to ensure that those who achieve their goals consistently often may surpass this range.
* Free Waxing.
* Discounts on all Retail Products.
* Industry Renowned Paid Training.
* Medical, Dental, Vision insurance.
* Company paid Short Term Disability and Life Insurance
* 401K and Employer Match.
* Vacation and Sick Time start accruing from day one of employment.
* Paid Parental Leave.
* Free Uniforms at Hire.
* Career Growth Opportunities.
* Employee Assistance Program.
* Commuter Benefits.
* Anniversary Awards.
* Being part of a Successful Team and Positive Company Culture.
* You could earn a bonus for each positive Google review, thanks to our partnership with Edge; a tool that turns guest feedback into additional incentives.


**Skills/Abilities:**


* Strong attention to detail
* Ability to communicate with guests to discuss their needs and preferences
* Ability to work flexible days and hours, including weekends
* A positive, friendly, and personable demeanor
* Ability to receive and provide feedback
* An ability to work independently with limited supervision
* Ability to work in a fun, fast-paced environment
* Maintain a professional appearance at all times as defined in the EWC Growth Associate Handbook
* A strong desire to work with others and engage new associates with energy and enthusiasm for EWCG


**Essential Functions, Behaviors, and Expectations:**


* Develop a thorough understanding of European Wax Center services and products
* Arrive to work timely following the appropriate dress code, including wearing of the required name tag
* Create a memorable guest experience by utilizing EWC terminology and tailoring the scripts and standard responses while working in the location
* Confirm each guest service(s) and offer recommended/related add on service(s)
* Administer check-ins and check-outs, processing payments, refunds and reservation requests
* Inform the guest of the prebooking benefits and how to utilize the app to reschedule
* Educate guests on benefits and savings of Wax Passes
* Organize the reservation book based on guest requests and associate availability
* Perform opening and closing procedures for the center
* Maintain a safe, sparkling clean, organized and visually pleasant environment within lobby and restrooms
* Other duties as assigned


**Requirements**


* High school diploma or GED
* 2+ years customer service experience or sales experience is preferred.
* Exceptional interpersonal skills.
* Excellent written and verbal communication.
* Good time management and organizational skills.
* Patience and good listening skills.


**Physical Demands**



While performing the duties of this job, the associate is regularly required to talk and hear. This position is performed sitting and standing at a desk and working on a computer, with times of prolonged standing, walking, bending, kneeling. The associate must lift and/or move items over 25 pounds.

  

**About the Company:**



European Wax Center is a beauty lifestyle brand that was founded in 2004, and has expanded with more than 1000 locations in over 45 states across the U.S. Our vision of Revealing Beautiful Skin takes place while we offer full body waxing services, an exclusive product portfolio, and an exceptional guest experience from the moment you Walk In until you Strut Out.



Visit us at waxcenter.com and discover how European Wax Center is committed to "Revealing Beautiful Skin!".



EWC Growth is one of the largest franchisees in the EWC network with more than 50 locations across 5 different states. Our Mission is to positively impact everyone who walks through our doors. EWC Growth, we’re more than a group of colleagues; we are warm, supportive, and deeply committed to teamwork to achieve a shared goal. Our values are rooted in our respect and appreciation for one another, and we are dedicated to building and encouraging a caring and understanding environment. We also believe we have a shared responsibility to enrich the lives of our associates and the guests that visit us.



Visit us at ewcgrowth.com and read more about our company values!


**EEO Statement:**



EWC Growth is an affirmative action and equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, disability, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran status, or genetic information. EWC Growth is committed to providing access, equal opportunity, and reasonable accommodation for individuals with disabilities in employment, its services, programs, and activities.

title: Call Center Manager
description:
Job Title: Call Center Manager


Team: Arctic Air Conditioning


Compensation: $90,000 - $100,000


Location: Old Bridge, NJ

  

Join Arctic Air for a dynamic career enriched with extensive training, boundless growth opportunities, a nurturing family-like environment, and a steadfast commitment to your safety and well-being. Your journey with us is not just a job, it’s a path to a fulfilling future!

  

Who We Are: Since 1977, Arctic Air Conditioning, Heating, Cooling and Plumbing has been focused on giving our customers the best value. We understand that calling for services is often not anticipated, so we make sure to give our customers as little stress as possible. Our customer service team is a pillar of the entire organization’s effort to increase our customer’s satisfaction.

  

Benefits:

* Full Benefits Package
* 401K with company match
* Life Insurance Policy Free to Employees
* PTO Plan
* Bonus Structure

  

Responsibilities

* Ensure the smooth functioning of daily call center operations, consistently meeting and maintaining performance metrics.
* Implement strategies to optimize call center efficiency, productivity, and service quality.
* Regularly report on call center performance to senior management, providing key insights and recommendations for improvement.
* Establish and monitor performance and quality control standards, proactively identifying and addressing any performance gaps or issues.
* Handle escalated customer service issues promptly and effectively, ensuring high levels of client satisfaction.
* Lead, manage, and inspire a team of call center representatives, fostering a culture of excellent customer service and surpassing set targets.
* Set clear performance targets, provide regular coaching, and feedback, and conduct performance evaluations.
* Conduct regular training sessions to enhance program knowledge, customer service skills techniques among call center representatives.

  

Qualifications

* At least 1-3 years of experience in a home service leadership role.
* Proven track record of achieving targets and delivering excellent customer service.
* Strong verbal and written communication skills.
* Proficiency in call center software and general computer usage (preferred)

  

Arctic Air Conditioning, Heating, Cooling and Plumbing is an equal opportunity employer, and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

description:
