title: Bindery Operator (Second Shift)
description:
Quantum Fulfillment Services is a book printer and publisher in the West Windsor area. We are seeking a highly skilled and experienced Machine Operator to join our team at a leading manufacturing facility. Quantum is an equal opportunity employer with advancement opportunities.

The ideal candidate will have a strong background in assembly line production, with a focus on manufacturing and fabrication. The Bindery Operator is responsible for operating the production equipment including binders, trimmers, and case-in equipment to achieve shift production volume and meet defined safety and quality standards.

**\\* The shift is 4pm-2:30am 4 days/week including weekends \\***

**Responsibilities**:

- Assemble and bind books, following detailed instructions and adhering to quality control standards.  
- Operate and maintain machinery and equipment, ensuring proper functioning and minimizing downtime.  
- Perform routine maintenance and troubleshooting tasks to prevent malfunctions and optimize production efficiency.  
- Maintain proper storage areas for materials and product inventory in warehouse  
- Collaborate with other team members to meet production targets and improve processes.  
- Move materials or completed products and packages to established locations  
- Maintain a clean and organized workspace, adhering to safety protocols and regulatory requirements.

**Qualifications**:

- Experience working in a manufacturing facility  
- Strong mechanical knowledge, with the ability to troubleshoot and repair equipment as needed.  
- Ability to work in a fast-paced environment with a focus on meeting production targets.  
- High school diploma or equivalent required; technical training or certification is a plus.

- Strong English skills are a must

This position offers the opportunity to work in a dynamic and rewarding environment, utilizing your skills to contribute to the production of high-quality products. If you are a motivated and detail-oriented individual with experience in manufacturing and fabrication, we encourage you to apply.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $16.00 - $21.00 per hour

Expected hours: 40 per week

Benefits:

* Paid time off
* Referral program

* Rotating weekends

title: Realtor/Investor Focus
description:
Tverdov Housing is a brokerage for agents who want to be exposed to the real estate investing space (flipping, rentals, property management, buy and holds, value add, development, commercial) while they work as a real estate agent. We train agents to become skilled realtors and improve their knowledge as a real estate investor. Working with us you’ll continue to develop your skills as a realtor, have access to training, be part of a startup culture and be prepared to become a real estate investor for yourself or a realtor who is ready to help one.

Tverdov Housing is a vertically integrated real estate company specializing in sales, property management, and construction services. Pete Tverdov, Broker of Record, brings go-getter, entrepreneurial energy like no other to the brokerage after over 10 years of working on Wall Street following his Rutgers Football career.

We are constantly growing and looking to expand our team. As one of our sales associates, you will be welcomed and encouraged by motivated, likeminded agents.

Currently we are only looking for already licensed, experienced New Jersey Real Estate Sales Associates. This is not a salaried position, upon qualification commission split would be 80/20 or 100%.

description:

We are seeking an Ophthalmic Technician to join our team. The ideal candidate will assist ophthalmologists in providing eye care services to patients. This role requires a strong background in optical and medical terminology.

title: Agency Nurse RN/LPN - Non-Profit
description:
**About Us:**

The Arc of Essex County is a non-profit organization that provides services and programs for individuals with intellectual and developmental disabilities and their families. Our corporate office is located in Livingston, NJ and we have programs throughout Essex County.

**Job Summary:**

The Agency Nurse is responsible for assessing, coordinating, administering, advocating and implementing health and wellness care for assigned consumers and training staff to manage consumer needs as per regulatory guidelines.

This role reports to the Director of Nursing Supports. This position is in person at our office in Fairfield, NJ and might require some commute to our programs in Essex County.

**Essential Duties and Responsibilities**:

* Provide and implement consumer care management to facilitate/coordinate needs as addressed in their health care plans
* Act as liaison between doctors/hospitals/nutritionists/mental health staff and programs
* Attend inter-disciplinary team meetings and relevant appointments
* Manage consumer hospitalizations
* Implement health and wellness components ensuring full integration of services into the program
* Conduct staff trainings
* Review medication storage and administration and maintain records ensuring compliance with regulations
* Conduct monthly Quality Improvement reviews
* Provide support to the Director of Nursing Supports in developing and recommending procedures and policies as they relate to consumer health and wellness needs
* Perform other duties as assigned

**Education / Work Experience / Skills:**

* Valid/current New Jersey State RN or LPN License
* Experience working in field nursing
* Valid New Jersey Driver’s license
* Basic knowledge of Microsoft Word, Excel and Outlook

**Requirements:**

* Excellent verbal and written communication skills
* Excellent organizational skills and attention to detail
* Excellent time management skills with a proven ability to meet deadlines

Job Type: Full-time

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* 401(k) matching
* Dental insurance
* Employee assistance program
* Employee discount
* Health insurance
* Life insurance
* Paid time off
* Referral program
* Tuition reimbursement
* Vision insurance

Work Location: In person

title: Principal Consultant - Clinical Data Management
description:
Infosys is seeking **Principal Consultant with Clinical data management** experience**.** As a Principal Consultant, you will be a key player in the consulting team that helps discover and define the problem statement, evaluates the solution options, and makes recommendations. You will create business requirement and process artifacts and assist with the overall deployment. You will also support knowledge transfer with the objective of providing value-adding consulting solutions that enable our clients to meet the changing needs of the global landscape.  

  

**Required Qualifications:*** Candidate must be located within commuting distance of **Bridgewater, NJ** **or Hartford, CT**be willing to relocate to the area. This position may require travel in the US
* Bachelor’s degree or foreign equivalent required from an accredited institution. Will also consider three years of progressive experience in the specialty in lieu of every year of education.
* Minimum 11 Years of Information Technology experience.
* At least 6 Years’ experience in End-end Clinical trial management process and related applications.
* Experience in Clinical data management applications such as oc/rdc/tms.
* Experience on clinical reporting (internal, FDA) during study start to closeout phases.
* Knowledge of Clinical Data Management processes with knowledge of Clinical Data Warehouse
* Experience in Computer systems Validation activities
* Familiarity with Good Clinical Practices, Good Documentation practices, Clinical Trial Quality & Compliance.
* Good Knowledge of Study life cycle activities (Study Protocols /study design for IRT and EDC Studies), various study milestones, clinical trial regulatory reports and other metrics reports at study level /site level.
* Must be able to translate business requirements into well-formed technical and system requirements
* Experience with modeling business processes, data flows, and workflow processes depicting relationships between Clinical data entities.
* Strong business consulting skills associated with complex IT system implementation spanning over 12-18 months.
* Strong oral & written communication skills, Business stakeholder management.
* Must have performed business requirement analysis, use case modeling from a business analysis/consulting standpoint.
* Experience and desire to work in a management consulting environment that requires regular travel.
* Experience in the full System Development Life Cycle (SDLC) on a variety of technologies and platforms preferably in pharma IT space.
* A basic knowledge writing custom queries in SQL or PL/SQL is needed for data extraction and validation.
* Candidates authorized to work for any employer in the [United States/Canada] without employer-based visa sponsorship are welcome to apply. Infosys is unable to provide immigration sponsorship for this role at this time.

**Preferred Qualifications:*** A basic knowledge writing custom queries in SQL or PL/SQL is needed for data extraction and validation.
* **Experience with project management**.
* **Experience and desire to work in a management consulting environment that requires regular travel**.
* Planning and Co-ordination skills.
* Good Communication and Analytical skills.
* Experience with Agile Scrum Methodology

  

The job entails sitting as well as working at a computer for extended periods of time. Should be able to communicate by telephone, email or face to face.  

  

**About Us**  

Infosys is a global leader in next-generation digital services and consulting. We enable clients in more than 50 countries to navigate their digital transformation. With over four decades of experience in managing the systems and workings of global enterprises, we expertly steer our clients through their digital journey. We do it by enabling the enterprise with an AI-powered core that helps prioritize the execution of change. We also empower the business with agile digital at scale to deliver unprecedented levels of performance and customer delight. Our always-on learning agenda drives their continuous improvement through building and transferring digital skills, expertise, and ideas from our innovation ecosystem.  

  

**Infosys provides equal employment opportunities to applicants and employees without regard to race; color; sex; gender identity; sexual orientation; religious practices and observances; national origin; pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions; status as a protected veteran or spouse/family member of a protected veteran; or disability.**

title: BCBA/LBA Clinical Supervisor- Center Based
description:
Family of Kidz is seeking a proactive and engaging **BCBA/LBA Clinical Supervisor of Enhanced Behavior Support Services** who is passionate about working with a best-in-class team that delivers the highest quality of care to families of children with autism and other behavioral disorders.

  


**Details about this opportunity:**


* Full-Time BCBA/LBA Clinical Supervisor of Enhanced Behavior Support Services (Center Based Services)
* Monday through Friday, 8am-4pm (Does not follow a school calendar)
* Salary range: $75,000-$95,000
+ Please note that this is a range. Salary is determined based on professional experience, services provided, and license/certifications held

* Hawthorne, NY

  


**What we have to offer YOU:**


***Family of*** ***Kidz*** ***Full Time offerings include:***


* Generous Paid Time Off
* 13 Paid holidays (including the week of 12/25 through 1/1)
* Medical, Dental, and Vision Insurance
* 401(k) -fully vested after 5 years, and discretionary EOY contribution
* Flexible Spending and Health Savings Accounts
* Life Insurance
* Employee Assistance Program
* Referral Program
* Professional Development Assistance
* Legal and Pet Insurance
* Long-Term and Short-Term Disability Insurance
* Team Building Event

  


**Responsibilities:**


* Initial Assessments/Evaluations (ABLLS-R, VB-MAPP, AFLS)
* Functional behavioral assessment and case supervision.
* Develop Behavior Intervention Plans and strategies that are individualized to the learner.
* Collect and analyze data in order to make programmatic changes.
* Run monthly parent training and parent meetings to discuss behavioral progress.
* Collaboration with Special Educators, Related Service Providers, and Behavior Technicians
* Continuous communication with teammates to understand and pivot when necessary, to enhance the needs of the learner.
* And more!

  


**About You:**


**If you have these attributes:**


* Passionate to work with children, adolescents, families and therapists
* High value and understanding of the principles of Applied Behavior Analysis (ABA) and the ability to apply these practices
* Sterling values, high integrity
* Excellent oral and written communication skills
* Exposure to the practice of maintaining a high level of confidentiality
* Excellent time management/organizational skills
* Act with humility and grace
* Empathetic & considerate of others
* Ability to function well in a high-paced and at times stressful environment.

  


**And this background:**


* Minimum of a master's degree in one of the following: Behavior Analysis, Special Education, Psychology, Educational/Health/Human Services
* BCBA Required, LBA preferred.
* Minimum of 2 year's experience as a BCBA.
* Minimum of (1) year experience working in a setting focusing on supporting children and adolescents with autism and other behavioral disorders.
* Experience with electronic data collection services.
* Bilingual is a plus.

  


Why Join our Family?



Since 1998, Family of Kidz has brought together highly qualified teams of professionals who work diligently to help children with special needs, from birth to adulthood. Our focus is on establishing a strong understanding of each child's needs and teaching them skills that lead to greater independence and an enhanced quality of life.

title: Finance Lead for Underwriting & Operations, Group Benefits
description:
Is the opportunity to join a culture where “We Do the Right Thing,” and “We Courageously Shape Our Future Together” important to you? If so, Guardian is seeking a talented and motivated individual to join our team as Finance Lead for Underwriting & Operations.
In this role, you will report to the Head of Finance for Underwriting & Operations, Group Benefits and play a pivotal role to help support all financial aspects of Underwriting and Operations within the $5B+ Group Benefits business. The Underwriting and Operations functional areas are comprised of nearly 1,200 staff (on & offshore) and $95M of annual spend. You will collaborate with Underwriting and Operations leadership and provide recommendations based on financial analysis to assist management in making decisions aligned to the strategic vision of the employee benefits business.
You will serve as a strategic advisor and business partner, providing critical insights and identifying emerging trends, risks, and opportunities for both the Underwriting and Operations value chains. Ensuring alignment between workforce planning and budget development for each function, you will also support business case development by offering guidance on estimated value creation and measuring the realization of benefits for all investments led by Underwriting and Operations.
You will:* Coordinate financial analysis for the Underwriting and Operations value chain.
	+ Operations: Implementation, Customer Set-Up, Enrollment and Billing, for both group and retail businesses.
	+ Underwriting: RFP, Rating, Risk Underwriting & Underwriting Operations.
* Provide enhanced analytics pertaining to both Underwriting and Operations value chains, while partnering with D&A team to develop and manage reporting inventory.
* Manage cost & benefit analysis related to business case development of new initiatives as part of the portfolio process.
* Measure benefit realization of implemented projects cases to ensure continued investment warranted for value creation and IRR estimates.
* Be responsible for providing financial analysis for automation and Artificial Intelligence (AI) projects that impact both operational functions, including input on use case prioritization.
* Partner with workforce planning (WFP) to provide financial guidance that supports strategic goals for both functions, including appropriate career framework, productivity improvements, expense discipline and customer experience.
* Develop recommendations and mitigations of staffing risks with management, and coordinate regular updates based on FP&A reforecasts of volume projections (sales & inforce).
* Collaborate with WFP and business partners to develop time studies.
* Drive results within team and with cross functional partners by assessing need, developing, and implementing processes to enhance workflows where applicable on key deliverables.

title: Platform Engineering Architect- AWS
description:
Orion Innovation is a premier, award-winning, global business and technology services firm. Orion delivers game-changing business transformation and product development rooted in digital strategy, experience design, and engineering, with a unique combination of agility, scale, and maturity. We work with a wide range of clients across many industries including financial services, professional services, telecommunications and media, consumer products, automotive, industrial automation, professional sports and entertainment, life sciences, ecommerce, and education.

**Responsibilities:**


* Responsible for building CI-CD implementation using Azure DevOps as a tool on Azure cloud platform for designated projects.
+ Subject-matter expert in Release Management, Continuous Integration and Continuous Delivery.
+ Responsible for Release Management lifecycle which includes scheduling, coordinating and the management of releases across the enterprise for multiple applications across various portfolios. The releases can be inclusive of application updates, security improvements, Projects and Programs.
+ Responsible for providing tool awareness and services to help product management and project teams manage and deploy releases into production.
+ Responsible for Implementing and managing release processes for code through development, test, and production environments Work collaboratively with all participants in software development projects and is supportive of developers and testers as they set up their build dev/test environments.
+ Responsible for Liaising with project leads/managers/Scrum Masters, quality assurance, operations groups and other key stakeholders on the release and delivery progress, issues and improvements.
+ Responsible for producing deployment run books and Implementation Plans Work with release engineers to understand impacts of branches and code merges
+ Responsible for developing and delivering scripts and automation tools used to build, integrate, and deploy software releases to various platforms
+ Responsible for all documentation including content for the department website on CI/CD (DevOps)
+ Ensure solutions are built based on Client standards and that they can be deployed with the Client environment (whether in a global or member firm environment)


**Competencies**


+ Must have effective communication with excellent logic and problem-solving skills and a drive to make a difference.
+ Experience in development and supporting enterprise applications
+ Good written and verbal communication skills with the ability to document and communicate technical information to IT professionals


**Qualifications**


+ Five years of CI/CD, DevOps experience with good understanding on Software Configuration Management
+ Well versed with Azure DevOps (VSTS)
+ Well versed with Azure offerings with work experience on the same as Web apps, ASE, ASP, function apps, SQL PaaS, Storage accounts
+ In-depth knowledge of the Microsoft platform (IIS, .NET, Web Services, SQL Server, SharePoint, Windows Server, Service Fabric, Active Directory etc.)

* Expertise knowledge on container-based applications (AKS).
* Experience to build and deploy applications on Linux environments.
* Ability to maintain and manage repositories on JFrog Artifactory.


**Education / Academics-**


* Bachelor's degree or higher from an accredited college/university in Computer Science or related field

  

Orion is an equal opportunity employer, and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, creed, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, pregnancy, age, national origin, citizenship status, disability status, genetic information, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

title: Experienced EMG techinician
description:
## Overview

We are seeking a dedicated compassionate EMG Technician to join our medical team. The EMG Technician will perform electromyography (EMG) to assist pain management physicians in evaluating, diagnosing, and treating neuromuscular disorders. The ideal candidate will have a strong understanding of neuroanatomy and electrophysiology, with knowledge of anatomy, physiology, and medical terminology, excellent technical skills, and a commitment to providing high-quality patient care. This position offers an exciting opportunity to work in a dynamic healthcare environment.

## Duties

- Prepare Patients for Procedures: Perform diagnostic evaluations on patients and explain procedures to patients, answer questions, and ensure they are comfortable and properly positioned for testing.

- Perform EMG: Demonstrate proficiency in EMG equipment, conduct EMG procedures under the direction of a physician, following established protocols to ensure accurate and reliable test results.

- Operate Neurodiagnostic Equipment: Set up, calibrate, and operate EMG machines and related neurodiagnostic equipment, ensuring proper electrode placement and machine function.

- Monitor and Record Data: Monitor patients during testing, record electrical activity from muscles and nerves, and document test results accurately and thoroughly.

- Maintain Equipment: Perform routine maintenance and troubleshooting of neurodiagnostic equipment to ensure optimal performance and safety.

- Assisting Physicians: Work under the supervision of pain management physicians and work closely with other healthcare professionals to provide comprehensive patient care and support diagnostic decision-making.

## Qualifications

- Education: High school diploma or GED required; Associate’s degree or certification in Electroneurodiagnostic Technology or a related field preferred.

- Certification: Certified Electromyography Technician (CET) or Certification in Electroneurodiagnostic Technology or Certification by the American Association of Electrodiagnostic Technologists (AAET) or equivalent preferred.

- Experience: Previous experience as an EMG Technician or in a related neurodiagnostic role preferred. Experience with EMG procedures is required.

- Technical Skills: Proficiency in operating EMG machines and neurodiagnostic equipment, including proper electrode placement and test execution.

- Knowledge: Strong understanding of neuroanatomy, physiology, and electrophysiology, as well as familiarity with medical terminology and documentation practices.

- Adaptability: Ability to work effectively under pressure and in fast-paced environments

- Interpersonal Skills: Strong communication skills and the ability to work well within a team

- Aspiration & Motivation for self-improvement Willingness to learn and adapt to new technologies and procedures

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $50,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* Flexible schedule
* Health insurance
* Paid time off

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift
* Day shift

Experience:

* EMG technician: 1 year (Preferred)
* Neurodiagnostic equipment: 1 year (Preferred)

Language:

* bilingually in English and Chinese (Preferred)

License/Certification:

* Certified Electromyography Technician (Preferred)

Ability to Commute:

* Brooklyn, NY 11220 (Required)

Ability to Relocate:

* Brooklyn, NY 11220: Relocate before starting work (Required)

title: Business Development Representative, Automotive
description:
**About Constellation:**



Constellation is a cutting-edge AI solution that empowers highly regulated and complex industries with the insights and content they need to fuel their business. Specializing in industries such as healthcare, automotive, insurance, and finance, our powerful data/AI insights tools inform the creation of compliant content at scale. We enable our customers to harness their data and streamline the creation of localized, personalized content. A global, NYC-based company, Constellation has been revolutionizing marketing technology and data intelligence in order to drive exponential growth since its founding in 2016.



Constellation was named the 65th Fastest-Growing Private Company in America, the 10th Fastest-Growing Women-Owned Private Company, and the 7th Fastest-Growing Marketing & Advertising Company by Inc 500. In 2022, our platform won the Digiday Technology Award for Best Marketing Automation Platform.

**About the Role:**



As the Business Development Representative (Automotive), you will be a key driver of revenue growth in the Automotive sector. Your main focus will involve reaching out to Automotive Dealers participating in Special Campaigns to arrange meetings and assess campaign effectiveness. Your objective will be to transition these enrolled clients into paying customers of Constellation's marketing compliance solution. Success in this position will be gauged by the quantity of scheduled meetings and the rate of conversion from enrolled clients to paying customers.



This role will require a qualified individual to work onsite three (3) days per week out of our New York City office.


**Responsibilities:**


* Identify and target Automotive Dealers that have enrolled in Special Campaigns to expand Constellation's customer base
* Proactively reach out to enrolled clients through phone calls and emails to schedule meetings, review performance, and convert to paid customers
* Conduct engaging and informative meetings with prospects to present Constellation's marketing compliance solution and showcase its value
* Collaborate with the marketing team to create compelling sales materials and presentations tailored to the Automotive sector
* Work closely with the Customer Success team to ensure a seamless onboarding process for new customers
* Continuously follow up with prospects to build relationships and move them through the sales pipeline
* Track and report on sales activities and progress, using CRM tools to manage opportunities and forecasts
* Stay up-to-date with industry trends, market developments, and competitors' offerings to identify new business opportunities
* Achieve and exceed sales targets for meetings booked and percentage of enrolled clients converted to paid


**Job Requirements:**


* 3+ years of experience in business development or sales in the Automotive industry
* High School Diploma required. Bachelor's degree in Business, Marketing, or a related field preferred
* Proven track record in achieving sales targets and driving revenue growth
* Strong understanding of the Automotive market and dealer operations
* Excellent communication and presentation skills, with the ability to build rapport and establish relationships with prospects
* Proactive and self-motivated, with the ability to work independently and manage time effectively
* Strong negotiation and closing skills, with a focus on achieving results
* Familiarity with CRM systems for managing sales activities and pipelines


**Other Job Information:**



This job description is not all inclusive. Constellation reserves the right to amend this job description at any time.


**Benefits at Constellation:**


* Comprehensive Healthcare, Dental, and Vision coverage
* Flexible PTO
* Hybrid work environment
* Casual in office dress code
* Competitive 401k plan with company match
* Commuter and Parking Benefits
* Paid Family Leave
* Catered lunches & free snacks and beverages
* Wellness programs and other employee perks


**Diversity & Inclusion:**



Constellation is an Equal Opportunity Employer, committed to providing a diverse and inclusive environment. Here at Constellation we don't discriminate against an applicant or employee on the basis of race, color, religion, creed, national origin, ancestry, sex, gender, age, physical or mental disability, veteran or military status, genetic information, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, marital status, or any other legally-recognized protected basis under federal, state, or local law.



If you need an accommodation during any part of the interview process, due to a disability, please let your dedicated Talent Partner know.


**Compensation Package:**



The total compensation package is made up of base compensation, equity, and benefits



New York Pay Range: $75,000 - 80,000 + Commission

title: Assistant Program Officer
description:
**What We Do**



With residents and partners, LISC forges resilient and inclusive communities of opportunity across America – great places to live, work, visit, do business and raise families.

  


**Strategies We Pursue**


* Equip talent in underinvested communities with the skills and credentials to compete successfully for quality income and wealth opportunities.
* Invest in businesses, housing and other community infrastructure to catalyze economic, health, safety and educational mobility for individuals and communities.
* Strengthen existing alliances while building new collaborations to increase our impact on the progress of people and places.
* Develop leadership and the capacity of partners to advance our work together.
* Drive local, regional, and national policy and system changes that foster broadly shared prosperity and well-being.


Since 1979, LISC and its affiliates have invested approximately $29.7 billion in businesses, affordable housing, health, educational mobility, community and recreational facilities, public safety, employment, and other projects that help to revitalize and stabilize underinvested communities. Headquartered in New York City, LISC's reach spans the country from East coast to West coast in 38 markets with offices extending from Buffalo to San Francisco and in 2,400 rural counties across 49 states and Puerto Rico. Visit us at www.lisc.org

 **BACKGROUND:**



LISC is a national non-profit organization that provides financial and technical assistance to community development organizations working to improve housing and economic conditions in inner-city neighborhoods and lower income communities. LISC New Jersey works to revitalize urban neighborhoods and improve the quality of life of residents to increase life expectancy by addressing the social determinants of health. Visit us at Greater Newark | LISC Greater Newark

  


**POSITION DESCRIPTION:**



LISC New Jersey seeks a multi-skilled individual, with a passion for strengthening communities through effective and thoughtful investment, grant making, and related activities. As a key member of this team, the Assistant Program Officer will help in successfully implementing a holistic, neighborhood-driven approach to community transformation that ensures both people and places prosper. The position reports to the LISC New Jersey's Deputy Director.

  


**KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:**



Under supervision of the Deputy Director, the Assistant Program Officer will support:


**Program Delivery & Capacity Building**


* Works closely with the LISC-NJ (LNJ) team, in particular, our Senior Program Officers and Program Officers, to coordinate and support the programs and activities built within LISC-NJ's capacity-building toolkit. This, at minimum, includes the following program areas of focus: Community and Nonprofit Leadership/Organizational Capacity Building; Housing Development Training Institute for emerging real estate developers; Family- and Income-Wealth-Building; and Economic Development
* Coordinate and facilitate regular peer group meetings and professional development opportunities for the LNJ team and for the external participants, grantees & other related beneficiaries of the aforementioned capacity-building toolkit. Includes providing logistical and programmatic support and coordination to advance relevant LISC-NJ programs
* Attend meetings, develop agendas and maintain minutes for various projects and internal and external meetings
* Assist with crucial partner engagement functions, including:
	+ Overseeing grant management and compliance, including creating grant agreements; reviewing and processing grant disbursements; reviewing financial and narrative reports and facilitating routine site visits
	+ Administer, track, and update partner impact reports, and communication materials used to promote programming, includes drafting "mini-case studies" and stories to highlight program successes
	+ Providing support to track progress on programmatic and funding milestones
	+ Provide support to develop and maintain partnerships with key stakeholders in the community development sector and create linkages between community-based organizations by collecting information on partners, identifying new potential partners, and responding diligently to partner request and questions.

**Administrative and Special Projects**


* Assist in various fundraising, development & communications activities, including, at minimum:
	+ Supporting grant writing and reporting as needed
	+ Updating and managing grants calendars. Includes maintaining funding data base/track funding opportunities via Salesforce
	+ Supporting key stakeholder, fundraising and other related events
* Assist with general office administrative management functions, such as, at minimum:
	+ Processing invoices, general office supply orders, various finance and accounts payable functions; and expense reports
	+ Utilize web-based applications for project management, file organization, and communication with internal and external partners
	+ Works with the Deputy Director to address other various administrative needs and other special projects as required by the Deputy Director
* Participate in peer-to-peer learning opportunities with other LISC markets and coordinate site visits as appropriate. Also attends professional development workshops, trainings, and other community events that align with individual and program goals.


**QUALIFICATIONS:**


* Bachelor's degree from an accredited college or university or equivalent relevant work experience
* Minimum of 2 years of experience in a professional field, nonprofit preferred
* Excellent writing and editing skills
* Strong organizational skills; efficient and detail-oriented; experienced and strong skills in oral communication
* Excellent computer skills including competency in full Microsoft Office suite
* Knowledge of community development
* Ability to collaborate with local partners and multiple teams
* Capacity to simultaneously work on multiple tasks and set priorities for a challenging workload
* Demonstrated commitment to working in the nonprofit sector
* Assist with other duties as assigned


**Required Core Competencies**


* **Community Development:** Commitment to an inclusive, racial-equitable, community-based, resident-driven model of community planning and decision-making for New Jersey neighborhoods.
* **Program Implementation:** Ability to develop and execute plans for community-articulated needs in partnership with stakeholders.
* **Communication:** Listens, speaks, and writes effectively to build meaningful relationships with team members and partners, and to convey information for the needs of the audience.
* **Organization:** Ability to design, apply, and maintain efficient systems for tracking time, tasks, resources, and other information.
* **Detail Orientation:** Ensures that information is complete and accurate. Able to deliver high-quality, accurate work.
* **Relationship Building:** Develops positive relationships and works well with others from diverse backgrounds.


**Preferred Competencies**


* **Judgement and Decision Making:** Considers the costs and benefits of multiple alternatives to reach the most optimal outcome.
* **Complex Problem Solving:** Identifies complex problems and reviews related information and data to develop and influence options and execute follow-through.

  


**COMPENSATION:**



LISC offers a competitive salary ($63,500 - $79,400 ; salary commensurate with experience and location)\\* and excellent fringe benefits.

* Actual salaries may be based on several factors including, but not limited to, a candidate's skill set, experience, education, work location and other qualifications.



Our benefits include:



Medical, Dental, Vision Coverage: Comprehensive health plans for you and your family's well-being; Disability Insurance: Long-term and short-term coverage for peace of mind; Retirement Savings: Secure your future with our 401(k) and 403(b) plans; Generous Holidays: Enjoy ample time off to recharge and celebrate; Vacation, PTO, and Sick Days: Take advantage of flexible time-off policies to maintain work-life balance; Tuition Assistance: Pursue your educational goals with support from our tuition assistance program; Referral Program: Earn rewards for referring qualified candidates to join our team; Professional Development Opportunities: Grow and advance in your career with access to ongoing training and development programs tailored to your goals.



LISC is an equal opportunity employer. LISC does not discriminate in employment on account of actual or perceived race, color, creed, religion, national origin, ancestry, citizenship status, age, sex or gender (including pregnancy, childbirth, lactation and related medical conditions), gender identity or expression (including transgender status), sexual orientation, marital status, military status or veteran status, unfavorable discharge from military service, physical or mental disability, protected medical condition as defined by applicable state or local law, genetic information or any other characteristic protected by applicable federal, state or local laws and ordinances.



We will endeavor to make a reasonable accommodation to the known physical or mental limitations of a qualified applicant with a disability unless the accommodation would impose an undue hardship on the operation of our business.



LISC IS AN EQUAL OPPORTUNITY EMPLOYER COMMITTED TO DIVERSITY, EQUITY, INCLUSION AND JUSTICE

title: Financial Analyst
description:
Are you ready to be part of a growing, value centric healthcare organization? At **SOL Mental Health***,* we are on a mission to help individuals find healing and balance. Our goal is to increase access to mental healthcare in a safe, inclusive, and non-judgmental environment where our patients and team members feel supported.



SOL is a rapidly growing integrated mental health platform, offering virtual and clinic-based care in 5 states and Washington D.C with further plans for growth. As a Financial Analyst at SOL, you will advance the role of metric-driven reporting and strategic analytics across the organization. This role will touch a variety of functional areas (finance, operations, growth, ops, recruiting, etc.) within the company and will have direct exposure to executive leadership. The ideal candidate is enthusiastic about taking ownership of key projects and working in a team-based mission-driven organization. This role will be accompanied by opportunity for career growth and promotion within the company and will report directly to the Director of Strategy & Growth. The position will be principally remote, but residency in Denver, CO or New York, NY is preferred.


**Primary Responsibilities****:**


* Prepare and analyze data relating to clinician productivity, patient outcomes, customer acquisition, and other items deemed necessary by business leadership.
* Assist in the compilation of monthly reporting packages, long-term financial model development, and other detailed financial analyses across the organization.
* Assist in developing financial forecasts and annual budgets
* Develop and maintain complex financial models to support decision-making
* Support project management for key enterprise initiatives, facilitating collaboration among both corporate and market leaders throughout the organization.
* Facilitate accountability and financial discipline throughout the organization by bringing together multiple data sources to design and develop reports that answer key business questions.
* Build, maintain, and continuously improve internal metrics dashboards within various analytics platforms.
* Identify and analyze financial risks and propose mitigation strategies


**Required Qualifications:**


* Bachelor's degree in Finance, Accounting, Business, Economics, or another related discipline with an analytical basis.
* Minimum of two (2) years of analytical experience required.
* Prior experience in FP&A, investment banking, corporate development, data analytics, and / or corporate strategy is strongly preferred.
* At least one (1) year of health care industry experience preferred.
* Demonstrated high-level proficiency with Microsoft Excel is essential.
* Proficiency in at least one of the following analytical tools is preferred: SQL, Power BI, or Tableau.
* Ability to synthesize, present, and effectively communicate financial information and analyses.
* Proven ability to thrive in a startup or similarly dynamic professional environment.
* Passionate about SOL's purpose to help individuals find healing and balance.
* US work authorization.


Sol Mental Health offers competitive pay, professional development, a collaborative culture, and a benefits program including PTO, Medical Insurance, Dental Insurance, Vision Insurance, Life Insurance, Disability Insurance, Voluntary Insurance, and a 401(k) plan.


**Compensation****:** $85,000 - $105,000 (base + bonus)

title: Stylecaster: Graphic Designer
description:
SHE Media is hiring a full-time Graphic Designer to join STYLECASTER's editorial team. The ideal candidate is a creative, digital-obsessed designer excited to spearhead the aesthetics for a modern lifestyle website that reaches over 9 million readers a month. STYLECASTER covers everything from celebrity entertainment and fashion to astrology and sex, and the designer should be adept at visual storytelling across categories. We're committed to inclusivity and diversity in design, and looking for a thoughtful, reader-driven designer to translate our ethos into eye-catching designs.



You will thrive in this role if you're self-motivated, effective at juggling multiple stages of design through the editorial process, and capable of adhering to deadlines. The Graphic Designer will report to the Editor-in-Chief, but will liaise with all editors on a daily basis. They will be expected to collaborate with other brand designers as needed/desired.


**Responsibilities:**


* Oversee the design & general aesthetic of the STYLECASTER brand & ensure all images/graphic elements cohesively represent our style
* Create designed images for five to twelve STYLECASTER stories a day, working with vertical editors, using stock imagery as well as creating custom illustrations
* Design digital issues, destinations and celebrity covers using CEROS with features like video and animation
* Spearhead the creative direction, organization, and production of photo shoots, supervising visuals on set
* Work with Branded Content team on images/graphics/social assets for branded content campaigns as necessary
* Create graphic templates & assets for STYLECASTER social platforms such as Pinterest, Instagram and TikTok
* Design tentpole banners and newsletter/email blasts with light HTML inputs


**Requirements:**


* 1-3 years of experience at a major digital media company
* A discerning eye for the lifestyle space, including beauty, fashion, décor, food, celebrity and entertainment trends is appreciated
* Expert knowledge of Adobe Suite programs, primarily Adobe Photoshop, Indesign, and Illustrator
* Experience with Ceros or Figma
* E-commerce and writing experience is a plus, but not required


***Typical wage range: $65k - $67k***


*Factors that could be used to determine your actual salary may include your specific skills, years of experience and comparison to current employees already in this role. The typical candidate is hired below midpoint of the range. title: Robb Report & Art Media Inc.: Manager, Integrated Marketing
description:
Robb Report seeks a creative and proactive team player to join our marketing team in New York City. Reporting to the SVP of Marketing & Operations, the Integrated Marketing Manager will generate integrated proposals and presentations for luxury brands and agencies, develop sales material and collateral utilized by our sales organization, and assist in post-sale executions. The ideal candidate demonstrates experience in creating custom proposals, highly proficient in ideation, custom content, digital, social, and post-sale executions. In addition, candidate should be highly organized, detailed-oriented with the ability to work on multiple ongoing projects.


**Responsibilities:**


* Works on creating pre-sale ideas and stories across Robb Report's assets including digital, print and events
* Provides strategic input, creative solutions, and concepts to Sales Directors
* Ensures all proposals address client needs while highlighting Robb Report's core values & capabilities
* Ensures proposals and buy rationales are clearly articulated
* Explores fresh and innovative ways to drive client business
* Leverages insights to tell the brand story including assistance with research pulls from Ipsos and MediaRadar, as needed
* Accompany sales team and/or marketing management on sales calls to present marketing platforms and client-specific opportunities in person Post-sales execution on an as-needed basis
* Assists with post-sale client executions across print, digital and events

  


**Requirements:**


* 3-5+ years marketing experience in media industry, experience with luxury brands a plus
* Ability to multi-task and efficiently manage time and priorities in a fast-paced environment
* Strong background in writing with the ability to communicate clearly and concisely in both written and oral presentations
* Big picture thinker and solutions oriented
* Knowledge of third-party research tools (e.g. comScore, Ipsos) preferred, though not a requirement
* A passion for media, collaborative spirit, and a get-it-done-right attitude
* Looking for someone who values working on a team, but can also be self-directed and work independently

title: Robb Report: Business Development Coordinator
description:
Robb Report seeks a motivated and creative team player to join our Business Development team in New York City. The Business Development Coordinator will mainly support the Director of Business Development and executives overseeing key functions in Product Marketing, Partnerships, Licensing, Legal, Public Relations, and Editorial. This person will oversee the successful maintenance of The Vault by Robb Report, the brand's new e-commerce destination for one-of-one products and experiences. The role will involve a combination of administrative support responsibilities and an opportunity to work on The Vault related projects handled by the Business Development and Product Marketing teams. We are looking for a highly organized self-starter who is eager to take on responsibility in a collaborative team environment that covers multiple aspects of Robb Report's business.



PLEASE NOTE THIS POSITION IS FIXED 12-MONTH PERIOD WITH OPTION TO RENEW.


**Responsibilities:**


* Provide general administrative support for The Vault including, but not limited, to project tracking and contracts;
* Assist with data collection, analysis and reporting;
* Provide cross-departmental support on The Vault initiatives;
* Oversee inventory management for products featured in The Vault;
* Maintain The Vault databases across the business development and marketing teams;
* Conduct research on companies, industries, marketplaces and competitors related to other strategic initiatives, e-commerce platforms and events to help drive innovative Vault integrations;
* Coordinate strategic brand partnerships and licensing opportunities for The Vault;
* Assist with content production, including presentations, copy and design;
* Assist with developing go-to-market strategies for new programs and oversee on-going marketing implementation for existing programs; and
* Work with the Public Relations & Communications team in the implementation of communication strategies for new and existing programs, tangential to The Vault.


**Requirements:**


* 1+ years of marketing and/or business development in the media industry, experience with luxury brands is a plus
* Proficient in Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint).
* Proficiency in Salesforce and AirTable preferred
* Strong background in writing and prior experience in proposal assembly and creation preferred
* Pro-active go-getter who can flourish in a fast-paced environment
* Outstanding attention to detail and high level of accuracy
* Ability to effectively multi-task and manage priorities
* Highly organized
* Excellent communication skills
* Team player but also a is a self-starter who can work independently


Typical wage range: $65k - $70k

title: Variety: Associate Editor, Legal & Finance
description:
**Variety** is seeking an experienced **Associate Editor, Legal & Finance** for its Focus team, which produces specialized industry sections and oversees extensive awards season coverage. This role is distinct from the news desk and web team but involves collaboration on various initiatives.  

  

The successful candidate will possess strong interpersonal skills to effectively engage with the entertainment legal community, business managers, and their respective PR teams. Responsibilities include overseeing key annual reports such as Legal Impact, Business Managers Elite, In-House Legal Elite, Music Legal Elite, Dealmakers Impact Report, and New Leaders.  

  

Candidates should be detail-oriented, highly organized, and well-acquainted with the entertainment legal and business management communities. Presentation skills, such as moderating panels, conducting interviews, and representing Variety at public events, are advantageous. Creative thinking and the ability to generate new business opportunities are also appreciated.  

  

This Los Angeles-based role requires a minimum of four days in the office per week. The editor will be responsible for assigning, editing, writing profiles, and proofreading content. Prior experience covering the legal aspects of Hollywood is preferred.  

  

**Key Responsibilities:**


* Assign and track stories to freelancers or staff.
* Manage deadlines and collaborate with the photo department for visuals.
* Edit for clarity, grammar, and focus, and write headlines and captions.
* Post stories on Variety.com.

  

  

**Qualifications:**


* Minimum 5 years' experience in print publishing.
* Excellent multitasking skills to manage multiple deadlines.
* Familiarity with InCopy, Microsoft Office, and WordPress is beneficial.
* Strong proofreading skills and a good understanding of the entertainment industry are essential, alongside a proactive and collaborative approach.

  


**As PMC values in-person collaboration and team cohesion, employees work onsite 4 days a week and 1 day remotely with a focus on maintaining a vibrant and inclusive culture.**

title: She Media: Design Director
description:
SHE Media is hiring a Design Director to join our New York-based editorial team. The ideal candidate should possess a strong understanding of the digital women's lifestyle space and a proven ability to produce engaging and on-brand visual elements that speak to an audience of women and moms over 30, as well as be a creative thinker and a team player who can gracefully juggle multiple projects and deadlines.



Reporting to the SheKnows Editor in Chief and working closely with the Flow Space Editor in Chief, the Design Director will own and oversee the visual aesthetic of our SheKnows and Flow Space brands, creating visual assets across our core categories (including entertainment, parenting, health, style, food and living) as well as leading the creative direction of all SheKnows and Flow Space digital issues and events.


**Responsibilities:**


* Oversee the design & general aesthetic of the SheKnows and Flow Space brands & ensure all images/graphic elements are in compliance
* Oversee the design & general aesthetic of all SheKnows and Flow Space branded content campaigns, working with freelancers and SHE Media designers to ensure they are aligned with editorial as much as possible
* Develop and maintain a roster of contributors, including photographers, glam teams, styling teams, illustrators, graphic designers, and more
* Create designed Feature Images for all SheKnows and Flow Space feature stories
* Design digital issues and destinations, maintaining the SheKnows and Flow Space brand aesthetics, using programs like Ceros
* Create and maintain brand books for SheKnows and Flow Space
* Spearhead the creative direction, organization, and production of photo shoots, in assistance with Editors-in-Chief and business manager
* Create standards and protocol for SHE Media photo shoots
* Establish and maintain production processes for digital issues and destinations
* Work with SheKnows and Flow Space social media editors to create a cohesive, branded look on all platforms for both sites
* Oversee the design & general aesthetic of all SheKnows and Flow Space events including event assets as well as marketing collateral
* Work with Branded Content team on images/graphics/social assets for branded content campaigns as necessary
* Create title cards and general design elements for videos
* Set the overall aesthetic of videos for both brands
* Design tentpole banners and newsletter/email blasts with light HTML inputs


**Requirements:**


* At least 5 years of experience at a major digital media company
* A deep understanding of the women's lifestyle space
* A strong eye for visuals
* A generalist sensibility and proven experience producing quality content across a variety of subjects
* A proven ability to perform under high-pressure conditions
* Expert knowledge of Adobe Suite programs, primarily Adobe Photoshop, Indesign, and Illustrator
* Experience with Ceros or Figma

title: Rolling Stone: Account Manager
description:
Rolling Stone is hiring an Account Manager. The Account Manager will be critical in our fast-paced advertising sales team. The role will be responsible for liaising with clients and internal departments to plan and coordinate all areas of digital and print media buys for the Rolling Stone brand. This position requires participation in all sales process stages- including creating media plans, gathering materials, optimizing delivery, and analyzing performance. This position also requires a passion for music and entertainment and a strong willingness to learn and be motivated by the opportunity to help shape and contribute to the team's growth.  

  

**Responsibilities:**  

* Create media-specific documents for campaign RFPs, including media plans, spec sheets, and screenshot decks
* Attend and participate in campaign brainstorms, assisting in analyzing proposals and generating ideas that meet client objectives
* Maintain knowledge and expertise of Rolling Stone products, pricing, and packaging for building media plans
* Understand and interpret advertising P&Ls to ensure pricing accuracy
* Assist in the management of day-to-day communication with key clients and internal stakeholders
* Build campaign performance reports for the client that are inclusive of information from third-party servers and site-direct reporting
* Gather insights from reports, data, and analytics to inform performance optimizations and future programs
* Aggregate and organize creative assets received for campaign execution
* Inputting media plan data into PMC and other third-party ad-serving systems, including Salesforce, Placements, and JIRA
* Provide support to a team of account managers to help strengthen pre-sale and post-sale execution (e.g., submitting campaign invoices, budget requests, campaign performance issues)

  

**Requirements:**  

* Minimum 2+ years of digital planning experience or account management experience at a digital publisher or digital media agency
* High proficiency in Excel and PowerPoint
* Expertise in ''media math''
* Proficient in planning across digital, social, and branded content
* High comfortability with managing multiple projects simultaneously
* Basic knowledge or understanding of media inventory forecasting
* Excellent Communication Skills - high aptitude for managing expectations

***Typical wage range: 65K - 70K***


*Factors that could be used to determine your actual salary may include your specific skills, years of experience and comparison to current employees already in this role. title: She Media: Programmatic Operations Manager
description:
We are seeking a highly motivated Programmatic Operations Manager to join our dynamic and entrepreneurial programmatic team. In this role, you will work closely with the Director of Programmatic, Engineering, and Ad Operations teams to operate and optimize our programmatic monetization stack. The Programmatic Operations Manager is responsible for managing day-to-day programmatic tasks such as inventory management, Private Marketplace deal set up and other programmatic related tasks with our SSP and adtech partners. This role also involves analyzing programmatic supply and demand trends to optimize and inform strategies. As a highly visible liaison with SSP and programmatic vendors, you will also interact with internal sales and agency trade desks. The ideal candidate is a self-starter, a creative thinker, and can effectively prioritize tasks based on impact.


**Responsibilities:**


* **Business Development and Vendor Management:**
+ Assist in the development and management of programmatic vendors such as SSPs, DSPs, DMPs, trade desks, and other inventory/programmatic vendors.

* **PMP Deal Management:**
+ Support PMP deal setup, optimization, and troubleshooting internally and with external DSPs and agency trading desks.

* **Data Analysis:**
+ Monitor and analyze data sets to ensure optimal performance and identify any irregularities.
+ Identify and suggest optimization strategies to increase Open Market and Private Market profits

* **Reporting and Dashboards:**
+ Work with internal teams to build programmatic data dashboards and reporting tools using Excel and Looker.

* **Ad Operations Management:**
+ Manage programmatic ad operations within Google Ad Manager (GAM) and various SSPs.

* **Internal Collaboration:**
+ Collaborate with Programmatic Sales, Publisher Operations, BI, and Engineering teams on daily operations and projects.

* **Onboarding and Vetting:**
+ Assist the Director of Programmatic in the vetting and onboarding of new demand partners.

**Skills and Background:**


* **Experience:**
+ 2-4 years of experience working within programmatic operations roles.
+ Strong understanding of the programmatic ecosystem from publisher and agency perspective.
+ Experience with DSP and/or SSP platforms is required.
+ Buy-side programmatic trading experience or supply-side publisher yield and operations experience is preferred.
+ Familiarity with platforms such as GAM, Magnite (SSP/Demand Manager), APS (TAM/CxM), Xandr, Index, and Pubmatic is strongly preferred.

* **Analytical Skills:**
+ Excellent analytical skills, particularly in handling large data sets using Excel and various data analytics platforms in order to identify revenue and yield opportunities

* **Technical Skills:**
+ Strong technical skills with a deep understanding of ad-tech and previous relevant experience.
+ Ability to troubleshoot programmatic deal set-ups
+ Ability to identify issues and opportunities and develop effective plans of action.

* **Project Management:**
+ Comfortable managing multiple projects simultaneously.

.


***Typical wage range: $100k - $120k***


*Factors that could be used to determine your actual salary may include your specific skills, years of experience and comparison to current employees already in this role. The typical candidate is hired below midpoint of the range. The total compensation package for this position will also include other elements, a full range of medical, financial, and/or other benefits including 401(k) eligibility and paid time off benefits.*



PMC is committed to the health and wellness of our employees. As part of PMC's paid healthcare plan, the company pays 100% of the monthly health, dental and vision plan premiums for the employee and their family. The total compensation package for this position will include other elements including 401(k) eligibility and paid time off benefits.



Details of participation in these benefit plans will be provided if an employee receives an offer of employment.



If hired, employee will be in an "at-will position" and the Company reserves the right to modify base salary (as well as any other discretionary payment or compensation program) at any time, including for reasons related to individual performance, Company or individual department/team performance, and market factors).



As PMC values in-person collaboration and team cohesion, employees work onsite 4 days a week and 1 day remotely with a focus on maintaining a vibrant and inclusive culture.


**About SHE Media:**



As a top 10 lifestyle media company reaching 74+ million monthly visitors, SHE Media focuses on the **power of content and community** to move our culture forward. SHE Media believes that media companies can and should be a force for good in the world. The company's rich editorial ranges from health, food, and family to career and entertainment.



SHE Media's flagship brands, SheKnows, Flow, StyleCaster, Soaps and BlogHer, produce award-winning lifestyle content and events that reflect the passion and purpose of the company. In addition to the flagship brands, the SHE Media Collective supports thousands of independent publishers and content creators with technology, education, and monetization opportunities to grow their businesses.



SHE Media has a longstanding commitment to the advancement of equity and inclusion through media. In 2021, SHE Media launched Meaningful Marketplaces enabling advertisers to buy media at scale from a community of women and minority-owned publishers, ensuring that independent media receives the economic support to thrive. SHE Media is also dedicated to advancing women's health. In 2023, SHE Media launched Flow, an all-new digital and live media platform providing content, community, and commerce in service of women's whole life health.



Part of Penske Media Corporation (PMC), SHE Media is based in New York, with offices in Los Angeles. Follow SHE Media on LinkedIn, Instagram, Facebook and Twitter.


**About PMC:**



Penske Media Corporation (PMC) is a leading global media and information services company whose award-winning content attracts a passionate audience of over 300 million globally. Since 2004, PMC has been a pioneer in digital media reaching viewers on all screens across its ever-growing constellation of iconic brands, which includes Variety, Rolling Stone, The Hollywood Reporter, Billboard, Dick Clark Productions, WWD, SHE Media, Robb Report, Deadline, TVLine, Sportico, BGR, ARTnews, Fairchild Media, Vibe, IndieWire, Artforum, Gold Derby, Spy.com and Luminate, the premier data and analytics company. title: Robb Report: Creative Director
description:
Robb Report is seeking a **Creative Director** to oversee the look and feel of multiple editorial properties, including the monthly magazine, editorial print supplements, web, video and social, as well as event branding, marketing materials and more. This senior leadership role requires an experienced manager and a proven thought-leader in design, structure and digital and print storytelling. Strong ideation and hands-on design skills are a must.



The Creative Director will be comfortable working collaboratively in a fast-paced environment while balancing various creative executions across different verticals, from travel and art to style and real estate. They will have a portfolio of original design concepts and be able to execute award-winning photography and videography.



This role is based in New York and reports to the editor in chief, but it requires close collaboration with the deputy editor and digital director, as well as category editors and the broader team.


**Requirements:**


* Minimum 8 years of graphic design experience at a publishing, agency, or media company
* Excellent communication skills, including the ability to articulate editorial concepts and ideas.
* Demonstrable expertise in print and digital design and eagerness to collaborate in ideation.
* Strong attention to detail and love of cutting-edge typography, design, illustration and photography
* Detailed knowledge of pre-press requirements for print: manufacturing process, proofing, and color correction
* Experience producing and directing photoshoots
* The ability to lead, nurture and develop the art department—art director, photo director and designer.
* A strong network of industry connections with illustrators, designers and photographers
* Manage budget and allocate spending for freelance, illustrations and photography
* Deep interest in luxury brands, experiences, trends and business
* Thorough knowledge of Adobe Creative Suite

title: She Media: Account Manager
description:
SheKnows Media is hiring an Account Manager, Publisher Partnerships who will manage a portfolio of SHE Media publishers and influencers. In this role, you will build and maintain strong partnerships with key publisher partners and work to optimize the value of their inventory by educating and guiding them on how to respond to industry changes (e.g. viewability, ads.txt, GDPR, etc.). The ideal candidate will be driven, self-motivated, collaborative, and like to build and shape orgs, has a passion and penchant for technology, an understanding of mobile, video and programmatic, excellent communication skills and ease with explaining complex topics clearly and concisely.


**Responsibilities:**


* Manage a portfolio of publishers and influencers, members of the SHE Media partner network
* Support network members who need help with ad code and/or template installation/change
* Help publishers optimize their ad configuration on mobile and desktop
* Help launch new ad products (native, video, channel partners) for your portfolio:
* Contribute to strategy and improvements for publisher tools and services:
* Develop and enforce compliance guidelines for pub network members
* Ensure that emails are responded to with excellent and timely customer service
* Supporting any other tech-related and publisher-related asks as needed:


**Requirements:**


* Previous experience with support or customer service, preferably in an ad network
* Proven ability and track record working in Wordpress back-end and implementing code
* Understanding of ad optimization metrics (e.g. viewability) and how to improve them
* Understanding of ad supported digital monetization and business models
* Knowledge and experience working with header-bidding for display and video
* Strong consultative sales skills, relationship building, and internal and external customer satisfaction management
* Self-starter capable of thriving in a fast pace environment
* Excellent communication (both written and verbal), negotiation and presentation skills
* BA/BS required


You know how to have fun: We are a fun company, and we genuinely love what we do, so charisma, a sense of humor and a thirst for learning new things will help.

title: Robb Report: Director, Live Content and Programming, Events
description:
The Director of Content and Programming, Events, will lead the development and execution of high-impact content strategies and programming initiatives for our events portfolio. This role is responsible for creating and curating innovative, engaging, and impactful content that drives audience engagement, achieves event objectives, and aligns with our brand's mission and goals. Strong understanding and passion for luxury sector is critical.



PLEASE NOTE THIS POSITION IS FIXED 12-MONTH PERIOD WITH OPTION TO RENEW.


**Responsibilities**


* Develop and implement comprehensive content strategies for a diverse range of events, including Brand events, Signature Experiences and Conferences.
* Identify key themes, trends, and topics that resonate with target audiences and support organizational goals.
* Collaborate with internal stakeholders to align content strategies with overall business objectives and brand messaging.
* Lead the creation of event content, including keynote speeches, panel discussions, workshops, and breakout sessions.
* Curate and manage a roster of speakers, presenters, and facilitators who can deliver high-quality, relevant, and engaging content.
* Oversee the development of written and multimedia content, including promotional materials, event programs, and post-event summaries.
* Work closely with the events team to ensure seamless execution of content and programming elements throughout the event lifecycle.
* Coordinate with external vendors, partners, and contractors to ensure all content and programming needs are met.
* Manage the content calendar and oversee the scheduling of sessions, speakers, and other program elements.
* Develop strategies to attract and retain attendees through compelling content and engaging programming.
* Analyze audience feedback, engagement metrics, and industry trends to continuously improve content offerings and event experiences.
* Foster relationships with industry influencers, thought leaders, and key stakeholders to enhance the event's reputation and reach.
* Collaborate with editorial, marketing, communications, operations and sales teams to ensure cohesive and effective event execution.
* Stay up-to-date with industry trends, emerging technologies, and best practices in event content and programming.
* Propose and implement innovative ideas to enhance the effectiveness and appeal of our events.


**Requirements:**


* Minimum of 7 years of experience in event content development, programming, or related roles, with at least 3 years in a leadership or management position.
* Proven track record of successful event planning and execution, with experience in both in-person and virtual event formats.


**Skills & Competencies:**


* Exceptional writing, editing, and presentation skills.
* Strong strategic thinking and creative problem-solving abilities.
* Excellent project management skills, with the ability to manage multiple projects and deadlines simultaneously.
* Demonstrated experience in building and maintaining relationships with high-profile speakers, partners, and stakeholders.
* Proficiency with event management software, content management systems, and digital marketing tools.
* Ability to work collaboratively in a fast-paced environment and adapt to changing priorities.

title: Rolling Stone: Commerce Writer
description:
**Rolling Stone** is hiring a full-time Commerce Writer to support its growing affiliate business at RollingStone.com. The incoming Commerce Writer will work closely with our Commerce Writers, Senior Commerce Editor and VP of Commerce to execute against a performance-driven editorial strategy supported by weekly content output and updates to historically performing articles on search and social. In this role, you will be responsible for delivering a consistent commerce content pipeline including but not limited to shoppable listicles, deal posts and product reviews. Content categories may include — music (events and tangible products), streaming, entertainment, tech & electronics, fashion, beauty, health, parenting and fitness.



The ideal candidate will have experience producing high-performance e-commerce content as well as a demonstrated interest in several of the above product categories. This role is best filled by a writer who is interested in topical cultural events, trends and is also product-knowledgeable. Experience with affiliate networks, related tools, SEO content strategies and content data analysis is required.



The incoming Commerce Writer will have an expansive list of ideas for content pitches — including product reviews and roundups that are a perfect fit for the RollingStone.com audience. This person must also have the ability to create eye-catching headlines and copy that embody general SEO best practices.


**Responsibilities:**


* Producing 10+ e-commerce stories a week on RollingStone.com optimized for search performance and relevant keywords
* Staying abreast of product and retailer trends and crafting pitches that align with buyer intent
* Reviewing search trends for specific keywords and/or relevant product search terms to prioritize content lists and optimize output towards the largest possible converting audience
* Continuously producing ideas and opportunities to expand upon Rolling Stone's existing commerce content expertise and helping Senior Commerce Editor and supporting Writers identify new niches that the business may competitive test and perform within
* Monitor sales and content performance and ensure notable points are included within weekly e-commerce revenue recaps to the total team
* Work closely with the editorial team leads to ensure SEO and editorial best practices are met for all content produc


**Qualifications:**


* 3+ years of professional experience in e-commerce journalism preferred. Consideration will be provided to candidates with experience in retail merchandising, retail communications/PR, commerce/retail copy editing and/or search optimized journalism
* A proven track record of executing data-forward performance strategies with proven results
* The ability to work independently, be extremely detail oriented and thrive in a fast-paced, deadline-oriented environment
* Daily experience working within publisher CMS systems (familiarity with WordPress, preferred)
* Having successful and current relationships with key market PR teams a plus
* Experience with affiliate marketing/affiliate networks a plus
* Proficiency with Photoshop or other image editing software a plus


***Typical wage range: $72,000 - $82,000***


*Factors that could be used to determine your actual salary may include your specific skills, years of experience and comparison to current employees already in this role. The typical candidate is hired below midpoint of the range. The total compensation package for this position will also include other elements, a full range of medical, financial, and/or other benefits including 401(k) eligibility and paid time off benefits.* PMC is committed to the health and wellness of our employees. As part of our company-wide rollout of PMC's paid healthcare plan, for this role the company pays 100% of the monthly health, dental and vision plan premiums for the employee and their family. *Details of participation in these benefit plans will be provided if an employee receives an offer of employment.*


*If you have more or less experience than specified on this job posting, please apply and list your salary expectations.*


*If hired, employee will be in an "at-will position" and the Company reserves the right to modify base salary (as well as any other discretionary payment or compensation program) at any time, including for reasons related to individual performance, Company or individual department/team performance, and market factors).*

Our Wellness initiatives rotate yoga, meditation, wellness weeks on a variety of topics, and financial wellness. We continuously elevate our offerings with more, for you.


**About Rolling Stone:**



Rolling Stone, the number one brand in music publishing, has been the leading voice of music and popular culture for 50 years. The multi-media brand features the latest in music reviews, in-depth interviews, hard-hitting political commentary, and award-winning journalism across many platforms including magazine, digital, mobile, social, and event marketing. Rolling Stone provides ''all the news that fits'' to a global audience of approximately 60 million people every month and publishes over 100 pieces of content every day.
