title: Hospice HHA Korean Speaking
description:
**JOB DESCRIPTION SUMMARY**



The hospice aide works under the supervision of a registered nurse and performs various tasks as assigned in accordance with the patient’s plan of care to meet the patient's personal needs and to promote comfort. The hospice aide is responsible for reporting and documenting observations and care performed.



The hospice aide will be assigned in a manner that promotes quality, continuity and safety of a patient's care.


**ESSENTIAL JOB FUNCTIONS/RESPONSIBILITIES**



Responsibilities of the hospice aide include, but are not limited to, the following:



1. Performing personal care needs after given a patient's assignment and attending to his/her requests promptly. If unable to perform a certain task, report to the Case Manager immediately.



2. Providing patient and family with positive communication techniques, within realm of ethical and respectful care, including confidentiality.



3. Meeting safety needs of patient and using equipment safely and properly (foot stools, side rails, O2 etc.)



4. Giving personal care including baths, back rubs, oral hygiene, shampoos and changing bed linen as often as assigned.



5. Assisting in dressing and undressing patients as assigned.



6. Assisting in feeding the patient as assigned. Hospice Aides may not provide patients with homemade food items or baked goods that they themselves prepared



7. Providing proper care and observation of patient's skin to prevent breakdown of tissue over bony prominence.



8. Reporting any complaint of pain or other symptoms or changes in the patient's condition to the RN Case Manager. Also aware of the caregiver or other individuals living with the patient and interpersonal issues.



9. Assisting in ambulation and exercise as instructed by the hospice nurse or therapist.



10. Provide normal range of motion and transfers/positioning as directed.



11. Assistance with self-administered medications as allowed by state regulations, such as “reminders.”



12. Offering and assisting with bedpans and urinals. Providing assistance as assigned with light laundry needs, emptying waste baskets and other light homemaker tasks.



13. Performing range of motion and other simple procedures as ordered with appropriate completed/demonstrated skills competency.



14. Providing respite for patient's/family/caregiver when on-site, as appropriate.



15. Keeping patient's living area clean and orderly, as assigned.



16. Adhering to the organization's documentation and care procedures and standards of personal and professional conduct.



17. Participates in quality assessment performance improvement teams and activities.



18. Respectful of patient and family/caregiver environment and patient's personal needs.



19. As a mandatory reporter, reports failure to comply with the requirements to the VA Dept. of Health as required within 14 calendar days, using Dept. of Health forms.



20. Reports suspected abandonment, abuse, financial exploitation, or neglect of a person in violation of VA State laws and ethics to the department of social and health services and the proper law enforcement agency. Reports must be submitted immediately when the reporting person has reasonable cause to believe that abandonment, abuse, financial exploitation, or neglect of a vulnerable adult has occurred.



The above statements are only meant to be a representative summary of the major duties and responsibilities performed by incumbents of this job. The incumbents may be requested to perform job related tasks other than those stated in this description.


**JOB LIMITATIONS** The hospice aide will not function in any manner viewed as the practice of nursing according to the Nurse Practice Act. Specifically, the hospice aide will not administer medications, take physician's orders or perform procedures requiring the training, knowledge and skill of a licensed nurse, such as sterile techniques.


**POSITION QUALIFICATIONS**



1. Completion of a state approved certified nursing assistant course or equivalent training with current license.



2.. High school diploma or General Equivalency Degree (GED)



3. Ability to read and follow written instructions and document care given.



4. Understands hospice philosophy, comfortable providing specialized care to the terminally ill.



5. Prior experience in hospice, orderly, acute , rehabilitative, or long term care facility. 1 year previous home health/hospice experience preferred



6. Basic computer skills to document in electronic medical records (EMR)



7. At least 18 years of age



8. Licensed driver with automobile that is insured in accordance with organization requirements and is in good working order.

title: Hospice RN CM Korean Speaking
description:
**JOB DESCRIPTION SUMMARY**



The registered nurse plans, organizes and directs hospice care and is experienced in nursing, with emphasis on community health education/experience. The professional nurse builds from the resources of the community to plan and direct services to meet the needs of individual and families within their homes and communities.


**ESSENTIAL JOB FUNCTIONS/RESPONSIBILITIES**


***Patient Care***



1. Completes an initial, comprehensive and ongoing comprehensive assessment of patient and family to determine hospice needs. Provides a complete physical assessment and history of current and previous illness(es).



2. Provides professional nursing care by utilizing all elements of nursing process.



3. Assesses and evaluates patient’s status by:



A. Writing and initiating plan of care



B. Regularly re-evaluating patient and family/caregiver needs



C. Participating in revising the plan of care as necessary



4. Initiates the plan of care and makes necessary revisions as patient status and needs change.



5. Uses health assessment data to determine nursing diagnosis.



6. Develops a care plan that establishes goals, based on nursing diagnosis and incorporates palliative nursing actions. Includes the patient and the family in the planning process.



7. Initiates appropriate preventive and rehabilitative nursing procedures. Administers medications and treatments as prescribed by the physician in the physician’s plan of care.



8. Counsels the patient and family in meeting nursing and related needs.



9. Provides health care instructions to the patient as appropriate per assessment and plan.



10. Assists the patient with the activities of daily living and facilitates the patient’s efforts toward self-sufficiency and optional comfort care.


***Communication***



1. Completes, maintains and submits accurate and relevant clinical notes regarding patient’s condition and care given. Records pain/symptom management changes/outcomes as appropriate.



2. Communicates with the physician regarding the patient’s needs and reports changes in the patient’s condition; obtains/receives physicians’ orders as required.



3. Communicates with community health related persons to coordinate the care plan.



4. As a mandatory reporter, reports failure to comply with the requirements of NJ state, local, and federal law and ethics as required within 14 calendar days, using Dept. of Health forms.



5. Reports suspected abandonment, abuse, financial exploitation, or neglect of a person to the department of social and health services and the proper law enforcement agency. Reports must be submitted immediately when the reporting person has reasonable cause to believe that abandonment, abuse, financial exploitation, or neglect of a vulnerable adult has occurred.



6. Teaches the patient and family/caregiver self-care techniques as appropriate. Provides medication, diet and other instructions as ordered by the physician and recognizes and utilizes opportunities for health counseling with patients and families/caregivers. Works in concert with the interdisciplinary group.



7. Provides and maintains a safe environment for the patient.



8. Assists the patient and family/caregiver and other team members in providing continuity of care.



9. Works in cooperation with the family/caregiver and hospice interdisciplinary group to meet the emotional needs of the patient and family/caregiver.



10. Attends interdisciplinary group meetings.


***Additional Duties***



1. Participates in on-call duties as defined by the on-call policy.



2. Ensures that arrangements for equipment and other necessary items and services are available.



3. Supervises ancillary personnel and delegates responsibilities if required.



4. Assumes responsibility for personal growth and development and maintains and upgrades professional knowledge and practice skills through attendance and participation in continuing education and in-service classes.



5. Fulfills the obligation of requested and/or accepted case assignments.



6. Actively participates in quality assessment performance improvement teams and activities.


**POSITION QUALIFICATIONS**



1. Graduate of an accredited school of nursing



2. Registered Nurse, with a License in good standing to practice in the state of New Jesey.



3. Registered nurses shall have a minimum of (a) one (1) year of experience as a professional nurse within the last three (3) years; OR have a baccalaureate degree in nursing and minimum of two (2) years’ experience, at least one of which is in the area of public health, home care, or hospice nursing is preferred.



4. Management experience not required. Responsible for supervising hospice aides may be applicable.



5. Once an offer of employment is made, it is contingent upon satisfactory references, as requested, and criminal background checks by regulation.



6. Excellent observation, verbal and written communication skills, problem solving skills, basic math skills; nursing skills per competency checklist.



7. Prolonged or considerable walking or standing. Able to lift, position and/or transfer patients. Able to lift supplies and equipment. Considerable reaching, stooping bending, kneeling and/or crouching. Visual acuity and hearing to perform required nursing skills.



8. Must be a licensed driver with an automobile that is insured in accordance with state/or organization requirements and is in good working order.

title: Hospice Chaplain Korean Speaking
description:
**JOB DESCRIPTION SUMMARY**



The Hospice Chaplain is responsible for the provision of spiritual care services to patients and families/caregivers, either directly or through coordination of care with other spiritual counselors.


**ESSENTIAL JOB FUNCTIONS/RESPONSIBILITIES**



1. Assures spiritual assessment of patients and families/caregivers in the hospice program and appropriate services are rendered in a timely manner.



2. Facilitates the development of the individualized the plan of care by participating in the comprehensive assessment to meet identified spiritual needs.



3. Provides direct spiritual care to patients and families/caregivers.



4. Serves as liaison and support to community chaplains and spiritual counselors.



5. Maintains records of spiritual care services utilization and related activities for quality assurance, program development, and policies and procedures review and revision.



6. Documents direct services and ongoing communication with community chaplains and spiritual counselors.



7. Attends patient care conference and interdisciplinary group meetings as a member of the interdisciplinary group.



8. Provides consultation, education, and support to the interdisciplinary group on spiritual care.



9. Recruits community chaplains, spiritual counselors, and spiritual care volunteers adequate to meet patient and family/caregiver needs by developing community contacts and offering education through congregations about hospice care.



10. Provides for funeral or memorial services for patients as requested.



11. Plans periodic memorial services to meet the needs of personnel, volunteers, and community clergy/spiritual counselors working with the hospice team.



12. Assists in supervision of spiritual care volunteers when assigned to patients/ families/caregivers.


***Communication***



1. Completes, maintains and submits accurate and relevant clinical notes regarding patient’s condition and care given. Records changes/outcomes as appropriate.



2. Communicates with the physician during IDG meetings regarding the patient’s needs and reports changes in the patient’s condition.



3. Communicates with community spiritual counselors to coordinate the care plan.



4. Serves as liaison between patients and families/caregivers and community agencies.



5. Maintains collaborative relationships with organization personnel to support patient care.



6. As a mandatory reporter, reports failure to comply with the requirements of the NJ Department of Health and will report as required within 14 calendar days, using Dept. of Health forms.



7. Reports suspected abandonment, abuse, financial exploitation, or neglect of a person in violation NJ State Law, DPH, and ethics to the department of social and health services and the proper law enforcement agency. Reports must be submitted immediately when the reporting person has reasonable cause to believe that abandonment, abuse, financial exploitation, or neglect of a vulnerable adult has occurred.



8. Works in concert with the interdisciplinary group.



9. Assists the patient and family/caregiver and other team members in providing continuity of care.



10. Works in cooperation with the family/caregiver and hospice interdisciplinary group to meet the spiritual needs of the patient and family/caregiver.



11. Attends interdisciplinary group meetings.


***Additional Duties***



1. Participates in on-call duties as defined by the on-call policy.



2. Assumes responsibility for personal growth and development and maintains and upgrades professional knowledge and practice skills through attendance and participation in continuing education and in-service classes and ongoing CPE.



3. Fulfills the obligation of requested and/or accepted case assignments.



4. Actively participates in quality assessment performance improvement teams and activities



5. Other duties as delegated.



The above statements are only meant to be a representative summary of the major duties and responsibilities performed by incumbents of this job. The incumbents may be requested to perform job related tasks other than those stated in this description.


**POSITION QUALIFICATIONS**



1. A bachelor's degree in religious studies or a related subject and a master's degree in theology, divinity or pastoral studies is required. (Courses may include biblical interpretation, human development and crises management.) Master's degree program transcripts should be able to document the completion of 72 semester hours, last approximately three years and may include an internship or one unit of Clinical Pastoral Education (CPE).) The Association for Clinical Pastoral Education defines one of unit of CPE as 400 hours of supervised meetings with persons in crises and includes ministry and peer evaluation.



2. Certification is preferred. Specific requirements for certification may vary based on affiliation, however most organizations require chaplains to be ordained or commissioned to minister and must present a letter of endorsement for chaplaincy from a recognized faith group. Usually a certification also requires at least an M.A. in Theology or a related subject and accrual of four units of CPE. Maintenance of certification varies by institution but generally includes continuing education, a peer evaluation and an updated letter of endorsement.



3. Ongoing commitment toward development through education and obtaining CPE.



4. Experience in hospice care preferred.



5. Comfort in an interfaith setting.



6. Ability to accept different lifestyles, cultures, beliefs, and values.



7. Ability to network with community clergy and congregations.



8. Knowledge of and commitment to hospice philosophy of care.



9. Demonstrates good verbal and written communication, and organization skills.



10. Once an offer of employment is made, it is contingent upon satisfactory references, as requested, and criminal background checks by regulation.



11. Prolonged or considerable walking or standing. Visual acuity and hearing to perform required chaplain skills.



12. Must be a licensed driver with an automobile that is insured in accordance with state/or organization requirements and is in good working order.



13. Possesses and maintains CPR certification (may not be internet based unless the demonstration of skills was hands on and observed by a certified trainer)

title: Cleaner (Shore Hill)
description:
WinnCompanies is looking for a **Cleaner** to join our team at **Shore Hill,** a 558-unit affordable housing community located in Brooklyn, NY.  

In this role, you will perform cleaning functions to ensure the appearance and physical condition of the property is maintained to ownership and management expectations. **Please note that the pay range for this position is $21.00 to $22.00 per hour, depending on experience.**
### **Responsibilities**

* Perform day-to-day tasks, which include, but are not limited to: cleaning windows, walls, floors, stairwells, laundry rooms, elevators, and carpets.
* Empty trash cans, sweep sidewalks, set up hoses, rake lawns and flower beds, plant flowers, and install mulch.
* Perform each cleaning function in accordance with the property's prescribed daily schedule.
* Remove snow and ice from walkways, parking lots, and driveways.
* Clean vacant units.
* Perform other cleaning functions as assigned by supervisor.

### **Requirements**

* Less than 1 year of cleaner or porter work experience.
* Excellent customer service skills.
* Prior experience using floor scrubbers and buffers.
* Ability to understand spoken and written English.
* Ability to respond to requests in a timely and respectful manner.
* Ability to do heavy lifting and other physical movements.

### **Preferred Qualifications**

* High school diploma or GED equivalent.

**Our Benefits:**
Permanent full-time US employees are eligible to participate in the following benefits:* Generous time off policies (including 11 paid holidays (12 for MA employees); Generous Accrued Time Off increasing with years of service; Generous paid sick time; Annual day of service; Floating Holiday)
* 401(k) plan options with a company match
* Various Comprehensive Medical, Dental, & Vision plan options
* Flexible Spending Account, Dependent Care Flexible Spending Account, Health Savings Account options with HSA annual employer contribution
* Long Term Disability and voluntary Short Term Disability; Basic Term Life Insurance and AD&D; optional supplemental life insurance
* Health Expense Reimbursement program (including gym memberships, equipment, and subscriptions)
* Tuition Reimbursement program and continuous training and development opportunities
* Wellbeing program (group challenges, seminars, opportunities to earn points to reduce medical premiums), Employee Assistance Program, & Commuter and Parking Reimbursement options
* Employee Corporate Discount Programs (Verizon Wireless, Home Depot Pro, Staples, and more!)
* Flexible and/or Hybrid schedules are available for certain roles
* Employee Relief Program supporting employees with unexpected hardships that place undue financial stress on them and their families
* To learn more, visit winnbenefits.com

 **Why WinnCompanies?*****A job you can be proud of*****:** WinnCompanies is a nationally recognized leader in apartment community management and development. Our team members are committed to helping people in the communities we serve and making a positive difference in their lives.***A job that challenges you*****:** Our employees are responsible for our growth and success, and we challenge our team members to always be their best in our fast-paced, dynamic and rewarding workplace.***A job you can learn from*****:** We offer multi-faceted leadership and learning opportunities to support our team members’ career growth and professional development.***A team that cares*****:** We value teamwork, innovation, diversity and mutual respect. Through our recognition and rewards programs, we’re committed to celebrating and uplifting our team members.

**About Us:**
WinnCompanies is a mission-driven, national business focused on building and operating top quality affordable housing communities for individuals and families of all incomes, including members of the U.S. Armed Forces and their families. Our people are the source of our success – 4,400+ team members working together to create the best possible living communities in 24 states, Washington, D.C., and Puerto Rico.

Whether your skills are in operations, maintenance, leasing, compliance, marketing, IT, HR, accounting or finance, there’s a role for you at WinnCompanies. Your passion for excellence can help us make a positive impact in the lives of real people every day.  

If you are a California Resident, please see our Notice of Collection here.*Current Winn employees should apply through* *this internal link**.*

title: Home Health Aide (HHA)/PCA
description:
ProLife Home Care is hiring Home Health Aide.

Responsibilities:  
- Provide home care services to elderly individuals or individuals with developmental disabilities, memory care needs, blind or other medical conditions.  
- Assist with activities of daily living, such as bathing, dressing, and grooming.  
- Administer medication and assist with medical documentation as required.  
- Perform specialized medical tasks as needed.  
- Prepare meals and assist with meal planning and nutrition.  
- Maintain a clean and safe living environment for clients.  
- Provide companionship and emotional support to clients.  
- Follow all HIPAA regulations and maintain client confidentiality.

Skills:  
- Previous experience working with individuals with Alzheimer's or memory care needs is preferred.  
- Strong communication skills and the ability to interact effectively with clients, families, and healthcare professionals.  
- Compassionate and patient demeanor when working with clients who may have physical or cognitive limitations.  
- Ability to follow instructions and work independently while adhering to care plans.  
- Knowledge of basic medical procedures and ability to provide basic first aid if necessary.

Please note that this position may require occasional travel to healthcare facilities for client appointments or consultations.

If you are passionate about providing quality home care services and making a positive impact on the lives of others, we encourage you to apply.

Summary  
As a Home Health Aide (HHA), you will be an essential part of providing compassionate care and support to individuals in their homes. With core skills in home & community care, patient care, and senior care, you will assist with activities of daily living, medication administration, and care plans. Your premium skills in patient observation, Alzheimer's care, and first aid will enable you to provide specialized care for individuals with memory care needs. Additionally, your relevant skills in cleaning, meal preparation, and medical documentation will ensure a safe and comfortable environment for those under your care. Join our team and make a meaningful impact on the lives of our clients.

Qualifications  
- Home health aide (HHA) or Personal Care Aide (PCA) certification  
- Experience in patient care, particularly in home and community settings  
- Knowledge of HIPAA regulations and patient confidentiality  
- Ability to provide care for seniors and individuals with Alzheimer's  
- Proficiency in patient observation and assisting with activities of daily living (ADLs)  
- Strong communication skills and ability to work effectively in a caregiving team

Job Types: Full-time, Part-time

Pay: From $21.09 per hour

Expected hours: 25 – 40 per week

title: IT Specialist - Academy
description:
SAR Academy seeks a technology specialist. The technology specialist is a valued member of a supportive, collegial technology team. They are responsible for supporting teacher, student, and administrative use of technology as well as maintaining technology infrastructure throughout the school. The ideal candidate is a hard-working professional, with strong organizational and communication skills and a particular interest in educational technology, systems administration, and effective tech support. This outgoing, team-oriented professional understands the needs of teachers and is committed to the advancement of educational technology in a school environment.
### **Responsibilities**

* “Front line” help desk work fielding support tickets and providing tech. support for students and staff
* Managing and maintaining devices for student & faculty 1:1 iPad program and faculty 1:1 laptop program
* Supporting the technology infrastructure throughout the school, including SMART interactive flat panels, network equipment, A/V equipment, IP phones, printers and other equipment
* Training faculty & students on use of school systems and software platforms
* Maintaining and creating technology documentation and tutorials for the school community
* Attending and participating in technology department and faculty meetings, and numerous after-school events during the school year
* Collaborating and sharing best practices within the technology department and the school community
* Diagnosing and troubleshooting hardware and software issues specifically related to smartboards, iPads, Macs, printers, copiers, and other educational technologies
* Setting up and supporting classroom technology equipment, including smartboards, projectors, and audiovisual systems
* Engaging in regular professional development that supports school, department and personal goals
* Maintaining and managing printers
* Maintaining hardware inventory
* Supporting tech set-up for school events
* Assisting with the management and maintenance of the school's network infrastructure, including switches, routers, and access points
* Performing routine maintenance tasks such as system updates, antivirus scans, and data backups
* Maintaining accurate records of technical issues and solutions using the helpdesk ticketing system
* Collaborating with the IT team to implement and enforce IT policies, procedures, and best practices
* Assisting with hardware and software procurement, inventory management, and asset tracking
* Other duties as assigned by the Director of Information Technology and Director of Technology

### **Qualifications**

* Bachelor's degree, technical degree or equivalent technology work experience, preferably in an educational setting, technology certifications
* Knowledge of basic networking and systems infrastructure
* Knowledge of computer hardware and software, including Mac and PC
* Proficiency with macOS, iOS, Google Workspace, Jamf, and Microsoft Office
* Familiarity with network infrastructure components, including switches, routers, and wireless access points
* Ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously with frequent interruptions
* Interest in working with people who have varying levels of technology expertise and interest
* Willingness to work additional hours during peak periods
* Ability to lift and carry up to 50 lbs
* Preferred certifications: CompTIA Network+, CompTIA A+, Apple Certified Support Professional (ACSP), Cisco Certified Network Associate (CCNA), Google Certified Educator, Microsoft Certified, JAMF certifications such as: JAMF Certified Technician (JAMF 100), JAMF Certified Administrator (JAMF 200), JAMF Certified Expert (JAMF 300)


This 12-month, full-time position in the Technology Department offers a comprehensive benefits package. The Technology Specialist reports to the Director of Information Technology. The salary range is $45-65,000 commensurate with experience. **About SAR:**
SAR Academy is a Modern Orthodox co-educational nursery through grade 8 day school located in Riverdale, NY. We are dedicated to the belief that every child possesses a divine spark, has unique worth as an individual and should be encouraged to achieve according to his or her ability. Our warm environment promotes confidence, creativity and enthusiasm for learning. In our approach to academics, we nurture students to develop intellectual curiosity, critical thinking skills and a lifelong love of both Torah and Secular studies.

title: Printer Operator (Second Shift)
description:
Quantum Fulfillment Services is a book printer and publisher in the West Windsor area. We are looking for an experienced Press Operator to run our web presses, both sheet and roll fed, to produce high quality results.

The Print Press Operator performs operation and maintenance of the printing equipment. This position will be responsible for operating our printing presses and utilizing a variety of tools to create high-quality printed products. Principal duties include installing and adjusting printing plates, loading and feeding paper, mixing inks and controlling ink flow, and ensuring the quality of the final printed piece. The Press Operator will also be responsible for keeping the printing presses and other equipment in good working order and performing other duties as requested by his or her supervisor

**\\* The shift is 4pm-2:30am 4 days/week \\***

**Responsibilities and Duties:**

* Maximize equipment up-time through timely response and effective operating procedures.
* Manage the utilization of assets and resources to achieve targeted production goals and create superior value for Quantum.
* Complete all aspects of the job on time and error-free.
* Provide accurate feedback with quality control and troubleshooting of equipment errors.
* Perform other activities that support Quantum and our service organizations.
* QC print quality of all products to Quantum standards
* Extended work hours and overtime, as required: approx. 150hrs - 300hrs per year with a minimum of 20 weekend days per year
* Completion of all company training and certifications within a timely manner

title: Human Resources Advisor/HR Advisor
description:
**Company Description  

-Your opportunity for a brilliant career**

We’re the world’s leading diamond company, powered by thousands of people around the world, with a mission to support local communities, protect our natural environment and shape a brighter future.


With headquarters in London and mines in four countries – Botswana, Canada, Namibia and South Africa – we are truly global. Established in 1888, our expertise ranges from exploration and diamond recovery to rough diamond sales and diamond jewellery retail.


We market our polished diamonds through two brands, Forevermark and De Beers Jewellers, while our Element Six operation is the world leader in the design, development and production of synthetic diamond materials for industrial and electronic applications.


  
Job Description  

-Reporting to the HR Manager – People Relations & Talent Acquisition, this generalist advisory position is an instrumental part of the HR People Services team. The People Services team provides shared operational and advisory support to the business and to colleagues across the People Function, providing the foundations of HR throughout the employee lifecycle. The HR Advisor will run the daily functions of the Human Resource (HR) department including hiring, interviewing, onboarding, and offboarding staff, administering pay, benefits, and leave, employee relations, investigations, and enforcing company policies and practices within the US across the business units.  



The HR Advisor plays a vital role in the HR (People Services) function, providing key services to the business and the broader People function and offering impeccable employee experience across all People processes and services, with an aim to make the lives of those we work with brilliant. The purpose of this role is to deliver professional HR (People Relations) Advisory support within the business, actively manage issues as they arise, take ownership of the employee life cycle and be the first line of advice to the business areas in your remit. You will play an active role in creating an energizing and cohesive workplace environment, actively flagging opportunities to improve processes and business outcomes, while ensuring De Beers Group operates within the legal requirements but also in the spirit of the brand.  



This position requires a detail-oriented, resourceful, and reliable individual who can work in a fluid environment while managing multiple priorities. You will have proven experience of building strong working relationships and providing advice on any organizational change, employee relations and people related issues, including matters relating to employment, compensation and benefits and first line employee relations.  



**The position is based in Stamford, Connecticut. The Stamford office currently works a hybrid schedule (3 days a week in the office; 2 days a week working from home).**

**Primary Responsibilities:**

* Providing operational HR (People) support by giving first level advice to managers and employees on key people management/HR processes and policies, responding to HR queries, completing HR forms accurately and timely for processing, problem solving where needed and triaging more complex matters as necessary, and providing excellent and timely customer service
* Manage benefit changes and day-to-day administration of employee benefits program including but not limited to health insurance, retirement plans, workers compensation, leaves, and voluntary benefits
* Monitoring and reviewing the effectiveness of HR policies, procedures and programs, staying current with local legislation and researching, recommending, drafting and implementing new or updated as needed, to strive for excellent compliance standards
* Performs routine tasks required to administer and execute human resource programs including but not limited to compensation, benefits, and leave; disciplinary matters; disputes and investigations; performance and talent management; productivity, recognition, and morale; occupational health and safety; and training and development.
* Maintains compliance with federal, state, and local employment laws and regulations, and recommended best practices; reviews policies and practices to maintain compliance
* Actively supporting relevant People agenda projects (culture, behavior, organizational change, I&D), champion Team + behaviors and work with peers from across the business to deliver against measurable outcomes while helping to mitigate associated risks.
* Interfacing with the wider HR (People Service and People Partner) team, sharing business updates to ensure a smooth operating rhythm meets the needs of the business area, working closely with People leaders to maintain effective and efficient service
* Maintains knowledge of trends, best practices, regulatory changes, and new technologies in human resources, talent management, and employment law.
* Working with payroll within the bi-weekly payroll processing deadlines and follow up on outstanding time approvals
* Processes invoices and taxes related to HR related items and collaborate with finance and payroll team when needed
* Supporting and driving change management implementations and People initiatives, collaborating with the relevant People Partners and senior sponsors to assure a compliant and risk mitigated process that delivers effectively on business requirements.
* Consulting with Supervisors, People Partner and Managers regarding employee performance and capability issues and drafting performance management related documents to support the process for Brands and Consumer Markets {DBJ, Forevermark, Lightbox, and Category}
* Support Line Leaders with updating job descriptions and partnering with People Partner and Reward team to confirm grading and banding for positions
* Manages full life cycle of employee including overseeing recruiting, creating offer letters, conducting background checks, employee eligibility verifications, exit interviews and terminations.
* Strategic partnership with benefit and policy brokers to maximize solutions and employee experience
* Performs other duties as assigned.

The base salary range $70,000 to mid $86,000K USD per annum.


  
Qualifications  

* -Bachelor’s degree (or equivalent) in human resources, business, or related field.
* A minimum of three (3) to five (5) years of HR related experience in a similar HR Advisor role, offering first line People/Employee Relations advice.
* Team player with the ability to deliver quality customer service to all levels within the organization.
* Detailed and highly organized, analytical, with strong written and verbal communication skills.
* Ability to exercise good judgment and discretion in handling confidential materials and matters.
* Strong working knowledge of MS Office Suite including Word, Excel, PowerPoint and Teams.
* Strong time management skills to deal with multiple time sensitive issues, a self-starter and the ability and flexibility to work in a lean, fast-paced, dynamic work environment, requiring constant prioritization of work; and
* Ability to act with integrity, professionalism, and maintenance of confidential matters.
* Knowledge of employment-related laws and regulations.
* Experience working with payroll and benefit systems.
* Experience with benefits and payroll are a plus.

  
**Additional Information  

-Who We Are:**

De Beers Group is a company with a sparkling future.


Our experts have searched the world for nature’s most precious gem. Our diamonds bring beauty to the world. But we think they can do so much more. We want our diamonds, and our business, to make life brilliant – for our people, our customers and the world around us.


**Safety**

Safety first is a way of life for us. We are unconditional about the safety, health, and the well-being of our colleagues, at work and at home, and about that of the communities where we work. We aim to lead the industry by investing in innovation to protect people, who are at the heart of our business. Our high performing teams take accountability for their own and others' actions, work collaboratively, and always show care and respect **.**

**Equity, Diversity & Inclusion (EDI)**

As a global #HeForShe Thematic Champion, De Beers is committed to promoting an equitable, inclusive and diverse workplace where we value and respect every colleague for who they are. We provide equality of opportunity to enable everyone to fulfil their potential. Please inform us should there be any specific requirements that should be considered as part of your application.


**Building forever**

Sustainability is at the heart of our decision-making – it is how we do business. Building Forever is key to our purpose as it represents our ambitious and holistic sustainability framework and is central to our ability to deliver long-term value to our communities and partners. This shapes how we protect our social and environmental license to operate, build a long-term legacy in our host communities and earn consumers’ trust in our diamonds that they can wear with pride.


**Inclusion & Diversity**

We are committed to promoting an inclusive and diverse workplace where we value and respect every colleague for who they are. We provide equality of opportunity to enable everyone to fulfil their potential.


**Background Checks**

Successful candidates will be required to complete background screening which may include a criminal check and validation of qualifications.

title: Automotive Service Advisor
company: Huntington Jeep Chrysler Dodge Ram Hyundai Genesis
description:
**The Role:**  
As a Service Advisor at Huntington Jeep Chrysler Dodge Ram, you are a crucial liaison between customers and the service department. You are responsible for providing excellent customer service, assessing vehicle issues, and coordinating vehicle repairs and maintenance services. The role requires strong communication skills, technical knowledge of automotive systems, and the ability to ensure customer satisfaction.

**Your Impact:**  
The primary functions of this role, include but are not limited to:

**● Customer Interaction:**

* Greet customers in a timely and friendly manner, making them feel welcome and comfortable.
* Obtain accurate vehicle information from customers, including VIN, make, model, year, and mileage.
* **● Documentation and Vehicle Inspection:**
* Write up customer's vehicle problems accurately and clearly on the repair order.
* Conduct a preliminary inspection of the vehicle, noting any visible issues or concerns.
* **● Test Drive and Evaluation:**
* Test drive the customer's vehicle, if necessary, to better understand and diagnose issues.
* Refer to the vehicle's service history to ensure a comprehensive assessment.
* **● Service Recommendations:**
* Inspect the vehicle thoroughly, identifying any additional service or maintenance needs based on manufacturer specifications.
* Provide customers with clear and detailed service recommendations, explaining the importance and urgency of each.

**● Cost Estimate:**

* Prepare a complete and accurate written cost estimate for labor and parts required for the repairs.
* Ensure transparency in pricing and answer any customer inquiries regarding costs.
* **Communication and Coordination**
* Maintain constant communication with the service dispatcher, service technicians, and the parts department to ensure a smooth workflow.
* Keep customers informed of the progress of their vehicle repairs throughout the day.
* Contact customers promptly if there are any changes in the estimate or promised completion time, providing a full explanation.
* Obtain customer authorization for all repairs
* **Customer Satisfaction:**
* Address any customer concerns or questions with patience and professionalism.
* Obtain the customer's signature on the repair order and provide them with a copy for their records.

**● Closing Repair Orders:**

* Close repair orders in a timely and accurate manner, ensuring that all relevant information is documented.
* **● Customer Satisfaction Index (CSI), Fixed First Visit (FFV) and Follow Up:**
* Strive to maintain high levels of customer satisfaction, as measured by the
* Customer Satisfaction Index (CSI).
* Aim to complete repairs correctly on the first visit to meet the Fixed First Visit
* (FFV) goal.
* Aim to follow up with the customer within 24 hours of the customer picking up their vehicle.

**Who You Are:**

● Punctual and reliable  
● Schedule flexibility - ability to work Saturdays  
● Attentive and welcoming when customers walk in the door  
● Outstanding communication skills- verbal & written  
● Professional appearance  
● Self motivated  
● Spanish speaking a plus  
● Knowledge of automotive systems and repair procedures.  
● Proficient in using computer software and service management systems.  
● Excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to work in a fast-paced environment.  
● Customer-focused attitude and the ability to build trust with customers.  
● Willingness to continuously learn and adapt to changing technologies and industry

**Who We Are**:  
● **Our Heritage**: At Huntington Jeep Chrysler Dodge Ram, we proudly stand as one of the most enduring Jeep dealerships on Long Island, with a remarkable history spanning over  
75 years. Huntington Hyundai & Genesis proudly stands as the original Hyundai dealership in New York. Our history dates back to the inception of the Hyundai brand in the United States. Over the years, we have played a pivotal role in selling and servicing  
Jeep, Chrysler, Dodge, Ram, Hyundai and Genesis vehicles to the local community and helping them experience the exceptional quality, innovation, and value that the manufacturers have to offer.

● **Family Owned and Operated:**We take immense pride in being a family-owned and operated dealership. This distinction sets us apart from many others in our industry. As a family business, we infuse our operations with a personal touch, dedication, and commitment to excellence that can only come from a close-knit team. Our family values extend to how we interact with our customers, treating them not just as clients but as part of our extended family.

● **Rooted in Huntington and Beyond**: Our roots run deep in Huntington and the surrounding areas. We have cultivated long-lasting ties to this community, fostering trust and rapport with our customers over the years.

title: Talent Acquisition Coordinator
description:
WebMD is the most recognized and trusted brand of health information and the leading provider of health information services, serving consumers, physicians, healthcare professionals, employers and health plans through our public and private online portals and WebMD the Magazine. The WebMD Health Network includes WebMD, Medscape, MedicineNet, eMedicine, RxList, theheart.org and Medscape Education. Our consumer portals and mobile health applications provide engaging, relevant and credible health and wellness information, personalized health assessment tools and access to online communities.


WebMD’s Talent Acquisition team is seeking a Talent Acquisition Coordinator to support PulsePoint, one of our rapidly growing divisions. This role is ideal for someone eager to learn the recruiting process, offering comprehensive training from scheduling and sourcing to full-cycle recruiting.
Responsibilities:

* Schedule multiple interviews with candidates; coordinate all details of interviews, including travel arrangements and act as point of contact for candidates on travel-related questions
* Ensure a positive interview experience for all candidates
* Engage in written and verbal communication with candidates and hiring managers throughout the interview process
* Manage Applicant Tracking System (ATS) candidate records
* Maintain accurate recruiting events calendar
* Support the Lead Recruiter in sourcing initiatives both domestically and internationally
* Assist with new hire onboarding
* Take on an array of special projects that advance the mission of our recruiting team
* Provide occasional administrative support for TA operations and freelancer support team


Qualifications:

* Internship or 6 months experience in a recruiting or human resources support role highly preferred (or similar internship)
* Competency in MS Office required
* Experience with Applicant Tracking Systems preferred
* Strong professionalism, discretion and customer service mindset
* Exceptional organizational skills and attention to detail
* Superior time management and multi-tasking ability
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills

  

Compensation: 55-60k  

  

**WebMD is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, ancestry, color, religion, sex, gender, age, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, medical condition, disability, veterans status, or any other basis protected by law.**

title: Roastery Operations Manager
description:
When childhood friends Holly and Shawn stepped away from their corporate careers and started Rook Coffee in 2010, they wanted to make people feel special. Since the beginning, in a 300-square-foot shack, Rook has focused on offering specialty coffees that inspire genuine, human connections.  

Rook Coffee is currently seeking energetic and hard-working individuals to continue to make those connections. If you’re nice, likable, approachable, a team player, proactive, patient, sociable, positive, reliable, and honest, we’d love to hear from you.  

Our roasting and cold brew facility, collectively referred to as “The Roastery,” is where our coffee begins its journey from green coffee bean to amazing roasted coffee or cold brew and our Roastery Operations Manager (ROM) is the person behind the magic. The ROM is responsible for the daily operations of The Roastery, including, but not limited to, coffee production, facility maintenance/organization, and team leadership.
### **Key Responsibilities**

* Interviews, selects, and trains top talent with the goal of creating a world-class production team
* Sets high standards, communicates expectations, and coaches for improvement
* Identifies and leverages individual strengths and assists team members with developing their areas of opportunity
* Develops and implements an ongoing training program for all team members
* Identifies and develops high-potential team members; participates in succession planning
* Partners and collaborates with key stakeholders throughout the company
* Oversees the production, packaging, and storage of roasted coffee and cold brew products
* Coordinates with the finance team to ensure adequate stock of coffee products to meet sales forecasts
* Audits product quality using all available tools, including outside laboratories, and course corrects, when necessary
* Is responsible for record keeping including roast/brew logs, roasted coffee profile logs, time/temperature curve, and roast data logs
* Identifies risks and develops and implements comprehensive food and occupational safety programs within the roastery
* Maintains appropriate stock of green coffee, ingredients, and supplies to ensure uninterrupted production of product
* Is responsible for the maintenance of all equipment including the roaster, bagging equipment, and forktruck
* Is responsible for the organization, maintenance, and cleanliness of all production and non-production areas, including offsite storage.
* Is responsible for the management and reduction of controllable waste as part of the coffee production process
* Ensures proper inventory control through the use of inventory management system and other forms of record keeping

### **Required Skills and Abilities**

* A **positive** mental attitude and outlook on life. A friendly and genuine personality is a must!
* **Experience** as a Head Roaster or equivalent role for a minimum of one year, with proven and consistent results.
* **Commitment** and ability to work independently and proactively are vital. Must maintain a comfortable and fair work environment.
* The ability to collaborate with peers and leaders across the organization.


Rook Coffee Roasters provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability or genetics. In addition to federal law requirements, Rook Coffee Roasters complies with applicable state and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment in every location in which the company has facilities. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation and training.  

Rook Coffee Roasters expressly prohibits any form of workplace harassment based on race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, national origin, age, genetic information, disability, or veteran status. Improper interference with the ability of Rook Coffee Roasters’ employees to perform their job duties may result in discipline up to and including discharge.

title: Field Service Representative
description:
Daniels Health is searching for a customer service oriented individual to join us as a Field Service Representative. This position is responsible for the inspection and servicing of all products within their assigned hospital or medical center. They will be responsible for maintaining inventory and delivering the first line of customer service on behalf of Daniels. The Representative will team up daily with drivers, operations personnel, sales teams, and corporate support staff to service their assigned hospital location. Through this essential service, you help create a safer healthcare environment for both patients and hospital staff!
### **What will your job involve?**

* Working clinical staff within your assigned location to ensure proper healthcare waste segregation, timely container exchanges and container fill accuracy
* Inspection and servicing of all Daniels’ products within your assigned hospital or medical center; this includes entering procedural areas and working around sensitive patients and equipment
* Maintaining adequate inventory levels of container stock at a location and department level
* Clear communications and strong relationship management with hospital staff and Daniels staff
* Communicating and escalating customers issues to your manager to ensure timely response and resolution with usage of a company provided smart phone for daily duties
* Maintaining professional, positive working relationships with customers and other hospital staff independently without direct supervision
* Ensuring staging area is neat and orderly after entering and before leaving the facility
* Standing and walking for a significant part of the day
* Lifting containers weighing up to 40 lbs
* Pushing / pulling wheeled transporters and/or palletized product up to approximately 300 lbs

### **What are we looking for?**

* COVID-19 considerations: Willingness to be COVID vaccinated necessary.
* Someone with a can-do attitude who is committed to efficient, timely scheduling and has previous experience in a labor-intensive job. Delivering an integral service to healthcare, this is a hands-on field service role carried out within a hospital setting and will include heavy lifting from time to time. No previous experience working in healthcare required. We’ll show you the ropes!

  

* If this sounds like the role for you, we look forward to speaking with you! If this opportunity doesn’t seem like the right fit for you but sounds perfect for someone you know, send them our way!

### **Why work for us?**

* **Job stability** – as an essential service to healthcare we are non-seasonal and recession proof
* **Opportunities for overtime** – we always need extra hands on deck so overtime opportunities are plentiful
* **Consistent work hours** – Monday, Wednesday, Friday at New York Presbyterian Queens and Tuesday/Thursday at Lower Manhattan -1st Shift (5:30am-2pm)
* **Benefits** – Full time roles are provided benefits, sick leave and vacation leave from day one
* **Permanent position –** This is a Full-time permanent role of 40 hours per week
* **Competitive salary –** This position is offering a rate of $20-22 per hour
* **Safe work environment** – We supply above and beyond the standard PPE protocols for safe handling of medical waste – find out more about how we protect you at https://www.danielshealth.com/covid-19-


If this sounds like the role for you, we look forward to speaking with you! If this opportunity doesn’t seem like the right fit for you but sounds perfect for someone you know, send them our way!

To find out more of what a day in the life of Field Service Representatives looks like visit - https://www.danielshealth.com/field-service **Who are we?**We are a healthcare service company providing safety systems and medical waste collection for hospitals, medical centers, surgical centers, nursing homes and an array of customers within the healthcare setting. Our focus is delivering quality and safety-focused medical waste management services that reduce needlestick injuries, positively impact infection control and reduce environmental burden. As a service to our customers we dispose and treat medical waste on site at our treatment facilities across the U.S.  

*Daniels Health & Sharpsmart is an equal opportunity employer. In accordance with anti-discrimination law, it is the purpose of this policy to effectuate these principles and mandates. Daniels Health & Sharpsmart prohibit discrimination and harassment of any type and affords equal employment opportunities to employees and applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. Daniels Health & Sharpsmart conforms to the spirit as well as to the letter of all applicable laws and regulations.*

title: Diamond Sales Expert - New York City
description:
VRAI is one of the fastest-growing digital-first direct-to-consumer brands. Modernizing diamond jewelry through the exclusive use of sustainably created diamonds, VRAI has innovation, craftsmanship, and sustainability at the core of its products and values. An honoree of Fast Co. Innovation Award in retail design, and a global business, VRAI has locations in Los Angeles, San Francisco, NY, Shanghai, Chicago, London, Madrid, and Copenhagen, with more locations on the horizon.  

We’re excited to be looking for a Diamond Sales Expert to join our growing team. You’ll be a trusted advisor in the customer journey and play an integral part in growing the bridal jewelry business at VRAI.  

This role is perfect for you if you thrive on building strong customer relationships and creating a memorable experience for life's special milestones. You love selling and diamonds that are created sustainably, and are excited to join a nimble team to in turn, help grow the VRAI brand.
### **Responsibilities:**

* Be a trusted advisor to clients and prepare personalized consults demonstrating our sustainably created diamonds and VRAI jewelry, then following up to close the sale. Act as an ambassador of the VRAI brand and our values, and assist them with jewelry selection, diamond education, jewelry care, and company policy (returns, upgrades, resizes, etc).
* Be sales-driven and a key contributor to company growth by maintaining a calendar of virtual and in-person appointments, managing your lead pipeline, and nurturing/developing leads.
* Join a team of high-performing luxury sales professionals committed to offering first-in-class service remotely and in showroom.
* Work collaboratively with other showroom and virtual sales team members on clienteling and custom design projects.
* Work collaboratively with the larger sales team on clientelling, sharing customer trends and product feedback to continuously improve the overall customer experience. Will also collaborate with VRAI marketing and product team on product launches, in-store events, press days, activations, and influencer hosting.

### **Requirements:**

* E-commerce or retail sales experience with proven ability to close sales in a high-volume environment.
* Diamond expertise and jewelry experience strongly preferred. Certified Gemologists from a reputable institution a strong plus.
* Independent, motivated, and well-organized with excellent writing and communication skills.
* Compassionate, positive, patient, people-person and technologically savvy.
* Available weekends.


Actual compensation may be higher or lower in the range based on various factors, including, but not limited to a candidate’s job duties, experience, and expertise. We will also consider higher level candidates and salary will be adjusted accordingly.
VRAI provides eligible employees with an opportunity to enroll in a variety of benefit programs, generally including health insurance, flexible spending accounts, retirement savings plans, life and disability insurance programs, and a number of programs that provide for both paid and unpaid time away from work. Additional Perks such as employee discounts are also available.  

Some plans may not be available pending global locations however other options may be presented.  

VRAI is an Equal Opportunity Employer and considers qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, creed, religion, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity and expression, age, disability, veteran status, or any other protected factor under federal, state or local law.  

This employer participates in E-Verify and will provide the federal government with your Form I-9 information to confirm that you are authorized to work in the U.S.
If E-Verify cannot confirm that you are authorized to work, this employer is required to give you written instructions and an opportunity to contact Department of Homeland Security (DHS) or Social Security Administration (SSA) so you can begin to resolve the issue before the employer can take any action against you, including terminating your employment.
Employers can only use E-Verify once you have accepted a job offer and completed the Form I-9.

title: Accountant (Grants and Accounting Specialist)
description:
Planned Parenthood of Northern, Central and Southern New Jersey, Inc. (PPNCSNJ) provides comprehensive reproductive and sexual health care, abortion services, education and information to women, men and teens at 17 health centers throughout 18 counties in New Jersey.  

**Job Summary:**  

The accountant specializing in Grant and Accounting will be responsible for managing and overseeing the financial operations related to grants, including budgeting, reporting, and compliance. This role will ensure accurate and timely financial reporting for both internal and external stakeholders, with a focus on maintaining the integrity of financial data. The ideal candidate will have extensive experience in grant management, financial analysis, and reporting within a non-profit/ governmental organization/ healthcare organization. **Qualifications:**  

Bachelor’s degree in accounting, Finance, or a related field
Minimum of 5-7 years of accounting experience, with at least 3 years focused on grant management and financial reporting.
Strong knowledge of Generally Accepted Accounting Principles (GAAP).
Proficiency in with financial software and advanced Excel skills.
Experience with non-profit, Healthcare would be a plus.
Excellent analytical, organizational, and problem-solving skills.
Strong attention to detail and ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously.
Effective communication and interpersonal skills.
Experience with Financial Edge would be a plus. **Key Responsibilities:** **Grant Management:**
Oversee the financial aspects of grants, including budget and forecast preparation, monitoring, and reporting.
Ensure compliance with grant requirements and regulations.
Coordinate with program managers to ensure proper allocation and utilization of grant funds.
Prepare and submit financial reports to grantors, ensuring accuracy and adherence to deadlines to include completion of the SEFA, assist with Financial and Grantor audits. **Compliance and Risk Management:**
Ensure compliance with all federal, state, and local regulations related to grants and financial reporting.
Monitor and enforce internal controls to safeguard assets and ensure accurate financial reporting.
Participate in risk assessments and develop strategies to mitigate financial risks. **General Ledger Maintenance:**
Assist in maintaining the general ledger by preparing and posting journal entries.
Ensure that all financial transactions are accurately recorded.
Track, calculate and maintain Fixed assets and depreciation schedules. ***This job description is not an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, skills, duties, requirements, or working conditions associated with this position. While intended to be an accurate reflection of the current job, management reserves the right to review and change this description as needed to maintain business goals and accomplishments. Job descriptions are reviewed periodically. This job description is not a contract.*****NON-DISCRIMINATION STATEMENT/ACKNOWLEDGEMENT:**
Planned Parenthood of Northern, Central and Southern New Jersey, Inc. (PPNCSNJ) does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, national origin, age, marital status, veteran status, citizenship, disability, atypical hereditary cellular blood trait, genetic predisposition or carrier status or any other characteristic protected by applicable law. PPNCSNJ will make reasonable accommodations in compliance with Section 504 of the Rehabilitation Act of 1973; the Americans with Disabilities Act of 1990; and any subsequent revisions or additions to related law/regulations.

title: Assistant Property Manager (Luxury Lease-up Property)
description:
**Overview**

Rose Associates is your gateway to innovative real estate solutions. With nearly a century of expertise since 1925, we're a leading force in New York City's dynamic market. Join us as an Assistant Community Manager, supporting our vibrant residential communities. Excitement meets opportunity here!

**Essential Job Functions**

* Assist in financial analysis, budgeting, and compliance paperwork.

title: Human Resources Director
description:
**Who we are:**

Community Counseling and Mediation (CCM) is a leading Brooklyn-based behavioral health organization committed to addressing the root causes and problems associated with mental illness, substance abuse, and alcohol abuse. As an innovative, community-based social service organization, CCM provides a wide range of social support, counseling, health, mental health, education, and supportive housing services to at-risk children, youth, and families in some of the most impoverished minority-populated areas of Brooklyn. With a history dating back to 1982, CCM has grown to serve over 25,000 individuals and families annually across Brooklyn and Manhattan. The organization operates over 25 programs and has become a key provider of culturally sensitive mental health services alongside educational, health, and social activities.

**Position Overview**  
The Human Resources Director will play a pivotal role in aligning Community Counseling & Mediation’s HR practices with its mission. This role manages payroll processing and all stages of the employee lifecycle, including recruitment, onboarding, benefits, leave administration, and offboarding. The HR Director is the primary contact for legal counsel, benefits brokers, and staffing agencies, and supervises an HR team.

**Key Responsibilities**

1. **Strategic Leadership**

* Develop and implement HR strategies aligned with CCM’s goals.
* Advise on staffing, position changes, and HR policies.
* Track and analyze HR metrics to ensure alignment with organizational objectives.

2. **Team Management**

* Lead and mentor the HR team, ensuring effective communication and collaboration.
* Conduct weekly one-on-one meetings to review progress and provide support.
* Perform evaluations and assist in creating development plans for HR staff.

3. **Recruitment**

* Collaborate with program directors to identify staffing needs and develop recruitment plans.
* Oversee the recruitment process, ensuring compliance and quality.
* Maintain relationships with staffing agencies for both temporary and permanent needs.

4. **Payroll Management**

* Ensure accurate and timely processing of semimonthly payroll.
* Work with the fiscal department to confirm payroll accuracy and compliance.

5. **Benefits Administration**

* Manage benefits selection, open enrollment, and administration, ensuring compliance with regulations and CCM policies.
* Liaise with benefits brokers for updates and issue resolution.

6. **Compliance and Risk Management**

* Ensure HR practices comply with legal requirements and industry standards.
* Collaborate with the COO, Chief Compliance Officer, and legal services on policy updates and employee relations.
* Conduct regular audits to mitigate risk.

7. **Performance Review and Training**

* Lead the performance review process, ensuring fair evaluations and training managers.
* Identify training needs, develop programs, and organize sessions to enhance skills and support growth.

8. **Employee Relations and Communication**

* Act as the primary contact for complex employee relations issues and escalate as necessary.
* Communicate HR policies and updates effectively.
* Foster a positive workplace culture through engagement initiatives.

9. **HR Policy Development**

* Regularly review and update HR policies to reflect changes in laws and practices.
* Ensure policies are understood and implemented consistently.

10. **Collaboration with External Partners**

* Maintain relationships with benefits brokers, retirement plan representatives, staffing agencies, and legal advisors.
* Negotiate contracts and service agreements with external vendors.

11. **Continuous Improvement**

* Identify and implement opportunities to streamline HR processes.
* Stay updated on industry trends and apply best practices.
* Lead HR projects that support CCM’s growth and development.

**Qualifications**

* Bachelor’s degree in Human Resources or related field (Master’s preferred).
* At least five years of HR management experience, including supervisory roles.
* Extensive knowledge of HR functions, benefits, compensation, and compliance with NYC and NYS regulations.
* Proven ability to align HR strategies with organizational goals.
* Commitment to diversity, equity, and inclusion (DEI) principles and supporting DEI initiatives.
* Strong leadership, organizational, and communication skills.
* Proficiency with Google Suite, Microsoft Office, and HR software.
* Professional certification (e.g., SHRM-CP, SHRM-SCP, PHR, SPHR) is a plus.
* Experience in NYC non-profit social services is advantageous.

**How to apply:**

To apply, submit your resume and cover letter via Indeed. Applications without a cover letter will not be considered.

*CCM is an Equal Opportunity employer. Equal Employment Opportunity has been, and will continue to be, a fundamental principle at CCM. At CCM employment is based upon merit and qualifications. CCM does not discriminate and is committed to making all personnel decisions without regard to any of the following: race; color; religion; creed; sex; gender (including gender identity and gender expression); sexual orientation; age; national origin; marital status; citizenship; disability; veteran or military status; genetic predisposition or carrier status; status as a victim of domestic violence, sex offenses or stalking; or any other protected characteristic as established by law. Our policy of Equal Employment Opportunity applies to all policies and procedures relating to recruitment and hiring, compensation, benefits, termination and all other terms and conditions of employment.*

title: Assistant Project Engineer
description:
Position Objective:

Perform activities necessary to progress projects from the design phase through construction and final completion.

Responsibilities:  
1. Ensure that the activities of contractors and consulting engineers are in accordance with contract documents and Authority procedures with the emphasis on construction supervision of Highways and Buildings facilities.

2. Functions as the Assistant Project Engineer and Authority liaison for projects that are underway concurrently.

3. Works in accordance with provisions set forth in the Authority’s Manual for Construction, Standard Specifications, Standard Drawings, Design Manual, and Design Standard Drawings.

4. Directs and manages the efforts of consulting engineers and subordinate members of the Maintenance Division associated with construction supervision.

5. Prepares budgets, estimates, plans, specifications, agenda information, maintenance agreements, and other administrative matters, as may be required to provide total project management of Maintenance Division projects.

6. Prepare requests for Expressions of Interest, Technical and Fee Proposals, reviews Proposals and recommends selection of consulting engineers, which comply with Authority requirements.

7. Capable of responding to roadway emergencies, weather related events, major traffic generating events, and/or any event which adversely affects the Operations Department, and/or the Authority on a 24 hour basis.

8. Must be flexible to work a reasonable amount of night and over night shifts to accommodate after-hour operations.

This is not intended to be an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties, skills, or requirements for the job. Management reserves the right to require that other or different tasks be performed as assigned.

Establish and maintain cooperative working relationships with all employees of the Authority. Represent the Authority in a positive, professional, and confidential manner in all dealings with external agencies, contractors, and all other individuals. Maintain professional demeanor even in high stress emergency and weather situations.

Minimum Qualifications:  
1. Bachelor’s Degree in Civil Engineering or Bachelor of Architecture.

2. Five (5) or more years of professional engineering experience preferably containing a mix of highway, structures, buildings, drainage, site, utilities and pavement design, contract document preparation, and construction supervision relating to various types of civil engineering projects, including at least two (2) or more years in responsible charge.

3. Knowledge of Microsoft Office and general scheduling programs.

4. Excellent verbal and written communications skills.

5. Must possess a valid New Jersey’s Driver’s License.

title: Property Accountant
description:
**Overview**

Rose Associates is your gateway to an exhilarating realm of real estate innovation. Our dynamic services platform spans development, management, and marketing, catering to private and institutional property owners globally. In the unparalleled market of New York City, where unique needs and challenges abound, we've solidified our position as the go-to industry leader.

Established in 1925, Rose Associates boasts almost a century of New York real estate expertise, continuously expanding across the tri-state area. Join us on the forefront of innovation and growth – Rose Associates is where excitement meets opportunity!

Are you a detail-oriented financial professional looking to make an impact in the dynamic world of real estate? Join our team as a Property Accountant and take your career to the next level! In this pivotal role, you'll manage financial operations for a diverse portfolio of properties, ensuring accuracy and compliance while driving financial performance. Bring your expertise and passion for numbers to a company that values innovation and excellence. If you're ready to thrive in a collaborative and fast-paced environment, we want to hear from you!

**Essential Job Functions**

* Manage the payment process for tenants, shareholders and owners to ensure rents are paid on time and correctly.
* Maintain and reconcile the general ledgers for various residential properties.
* Coordinate audits with client accountants and independent CPA firms.
* Create and maintain work papers in support of account balances.
* Ensure compliance with reporting deadlines on a monthly, quarterly and annual basis.
* Provide administrative support to Senior Accountants.
* Position may be required to perform duties outside their normal responsibilities as needed and when requested.
* For assigned properties, ensure that financial records which reach the materiality level are 100% accurate according to internal and GAAP standards.
* Close year-end reports in a timely manner to meet auditor and building board schedules.
* Meet client monthly reporting deadlines.
* Must be present with the ability to move throughout our corporate office to address property related matters, ensuring effective communication with staff, vendors, and visitors.
* Position may be required to perform duties outside their normal responsibilities as needed.

**Qualifications**

* Bachelor’s degree in Finance/Accounting.
* A minimum of 7 years of accounting experience within the real estate industry, residential real estate experience preferred.
* CPA license preferred.
* Manages multiple priorities with time management techniques and flexibility in task prioritization.
* Exhibit an understanding of the interaction among the accounting processes, regulatory requirements and customer needs and makes suggestions to improve operating efficiency or effectiveness.
* Demonstrate strong written and verbal communication skills, adept at managing multiple inquiries with time-sensitive deadlines; possesses excellent organizational, time management, and communication skills.
* Proficiency in navigating computers and property management software, to include AVID, ClickPay, Yardi, MRI and Microsoft Office, particularly pivot tables, macros and VLOOKUPS.
* Work authorization (required)

Rose Associates requires all colleagues to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 unless there is an approved religious or medical exemption.
